description: Chermoula is a marinade or sauce that forms the basis of many Moroccan dishes. This version made with eggplant, basil, dried herbs and lime can be used as a great dip.
method: Pre-heat oven to 400 degree f, arrange oven that has low and high rack in the oven.
2.Cut a shallow slit along the side of the eggplant. And place into a baking dish.

Roast in preheat oven on the lower rack until the eggplant is completely shrunken and soft, about 40 minutes. Move dish to higher rack and continue baking until the skin is charred. About 5 minutes more. Let eggplant cool until cool enough to handle.
Peal and discard skin from eggplant. Put eggplant into a bowl add tahini, garlic, lemon juice, mint leaf chopped, rosemary, thyme, green chilly, and salt
Stir until ingredients are evenly mixed drizzle olive oil over the B&B Aubergine charmoula sauce and garnish with parsley.
name: Aubergine Chermoula Sauce

description: This is possibly the quickest of all soups we make at home, and along with my watermelon soup (below), it one of the coolest, most soothing summer dishes.
method: Peel and chop the cucumbers, roughly, if you like, scrape off the seeds but I usually keep them in because I like the texture.
Blend everything in the blender, then season and cool. If you find the texture to be too thick, then add a little cold water to make the consistency as thin as you like. Done!

To posh it up, you can serve this with garlic bread or croutons. For croutons, take any old bread, brush on both sides with olive oil, then slice into cubes. Toast (or fry, for a truly decadent version) them until crisp, then scatter over the soup just before serving. The truly health-conscious may even omit entirely the olive oil step.
name: Cucumber Soup

description: A fruit soup! And what is more summery than a crisp, chilled watermelon? This is a fairly easy recipe but for the laborious deseeding of the watermelon.
method: Sauté the ginger-garlic paste and the chilli flakes in a little olive oil. Set aside to cool.

Puree the watermelon and the mint in a blender until thoroughly blended. Add the watermelon puree into the saucepan with the ginger-garlic and chilli flakes, and simmer, until it thickens a little bit. Season well, then chill for at least 1-2 hours before serving.
You can add a couple of ice cubes into the soup, spoon over some olive oil and serve garnished with a sprig of mint. This is a soup that is best eaten the same day of preparation.
name: Spicy Watermelon Soup

description: There's nothing like roasted pumpkin. Team it with hummus and it's a lip-smacking treat. Spice it up with red chilli powder and Tabasco sauce, and if you have za'atar, add that in too.
method: Oil the pumpkin slice and roast it in the oven for 15 minutes.
In a food processer or blender, mix chickpeas and garlic, and pulse until smooth. You can add a little water, if you find the mixture a little dry.
Add the pumpkin, cumin powder, Tabasco sauce, olive oil and salt, and blend again until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl, and add the lemon juice. Mix well and check seasoning. Finish with a drizzling of olive oil, a sprinkling of red chilli powder and rosemary sprigs on top. Serve with pita breads.
name: Spicy Pumpkin Hummus

description: Pork and Litchi together? Sounds odd but tastes delicious. Try this unique combination this summer.
ingredients: 1/2 kg of pork, deboned and cleaned
1 cup of litchis, peeled and seeded
method: 1. Cube the pork, then dip them into the cornstarch. Deep fry for 5 minutes until cooked, then set aside.
In a large kadhai, throw together the rest of the ingredients until the stock and vinegar come to a boil.
Add the pork and simmer at low heat, covered, for 2 minutes. Serve with steamed rice.
name: Pork Litchi

description: This one is an extremely easy salad, quick to put together and perfect for those days when you just can't be bothered.
ingredients: 2 tbsp of spring onions, chopped roughly
A handful of peanuts, to garnish
method: 1. Toss the oil together with the lemon juice, spring onions and chilli flakes. Use this as a marinade for the prawns - let them marinate for 15 minutes in this mixture.
Toss the prawns together with the marinade on high heat in a kadhai and stir fry for about 2-3 minutes, by which time the prawns should be cooked.
Set aside, while you mix together the mango and litchi, then add everything together, add the peanuts for a bit of crunch, season and serve immediately.
name: Prawn and Litchi Salad

description: If you are looking for a no-fuss but extremely delicious snack, this is your pick. Grab those exotic vegetables you have been eyeing for a while and give them a new twist. A pinch of five spice powder brings out the depth of your fritters. Enjoy them with a nice game of football and a cold glass of iced tea.
method: 1.Wash all the vegetables and cut them in even size.
Make the batter by mixing tempura flour with cold water, if any lumps don't worry.
Take a kadhai and put olive oil in it. Once the temperature reaches to 160 degree fry the glass
noodles and make a desired shape as shown in picture or make any other shape like a basket.
Chop the spring onions and keep it aside for garnish.
Dip the vegetables into the batter and fry them till it becomes crisp. Take it out on a tissue paper to remove excess oil.
6.Toss these vegetables with salt, pepper and Chinese five spice powder and enjoy these
vegetables in your daily routine.
Serve hot.
name: Crunchy Vegetables and Corn With Five Spice Powder

description: This recipe brings together the two most popular condiments - pesto and hummus. Serve it with crisp toasts or vegetable crudites and win praises from your friends and family.
ingredients: 1 cup of  basil leaves, plus extra for garnish
1/2 cup olive oil, plus extra for topping
method: Method:

First prepare the pesto sauce: mix basil leaves, garlic, Parmesan and pine nuts in a blender. Add the olive oil, a little at a time to emulsify, and continue blending until all the ingredients come together.
Add the chickpeas and salt, and blend again until smooth.

Transfer to a bowl, and add the lemon juice. Mix well and check seasoning. Finish with a drizzling of olive oil, a sprinkling of red chilli powder and fresh basil leaves on top. Serve with pita breads.
name: Basil Pesto Hummus

description: A perfect summer dip, the flavours of lemon and basil come together to make this recipe light and refreshing.
ingredients: ½ cup olive oil, plus extra for topping
method: In a pan, roast the sesame seeds until aromatic. Allow to cool and then ground into a powder.
In a food processor or blender, mix chickpeas and garlic, and pulse until smooth. You can add a little water, if you find the mixture a little dry.
Add the sesame powder, curd, cumin powder and salt, and blend again until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl, and add the lemon juice. Mix well and check seasoning.
In a blender, pulse the basil leaves and olive oil till well mixed.
Top it on the prepared hummus, along with a sprinkling of red chilli powder and fresh basil leaves. Serve with pita breads.
name: Lemony Hummus with Basil Dressing

description: Black beans push over chickpeas in this recipe to make this classic dip. Blend it with fresh herbs and spices, and serve it with breads.
method: In a food processor or blender, mix the black beans, sesame seeds and garlic, and pulse until smooth. You can add a little water, if you find the mixture a little dry.
Add the cumin powder, black pepper powder, curd, olive oil and salt, and blend again until smooth.
Transfer to a bowl, and add the lemon juice. Mix well and check seasoning. Finish with a drizzling of olive oil and coriander sprigs on top. Serve with pita breads.
name: Black Bean Hummus

description: A perfect cooler to go with your meal. This raita combines the goodness and sweetness of pineapple with soothing curd. A beautiful blend of flavours.
method: Cut pineapple into 2" cubes.
Put them on a skewer and cook in a tandoori till soft but not mushy.
Whisk the yoghurt in a bowl till smooth and add cooled and chopped pineapple, reserving little bit for garnish.
Add the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Garnish with chopped pineapple and mint Sprig.
name: Pineapple Raita

description: This basic condiment is a must have for your cooking. Now, ditch the store-bought packs and make it fresh at home.
method: Mix all ingredients well
Store in an airtight jar
name: Channa Masala

description: Mango season would be devoid of all its glory if you don't try this classic accompaniment along with those hot and crisp pooris or parathas.
method: Chill 4 mangoes in the fridge for a few hours. The mangoes which have started wrinkling are the best for aamras.
Massage the fruit with its skin on. Then squeeze out the pulp. Mix in sugar only if needed.
3 .Add cardamom powder and mix well with a wooden blender.
Leave the aamras pulpy and thick. Portion out in small serves in steel bowls or pretty glasses. Top serve with molten ghee.
name: Aamras

description: This is one of the easier biscuit recipes that don't require a blending of various flours. They are pretty healthy and made using coconut oil.
ingredients: Orange or vanilla essence (or rose or lemon or whichever you choose)
method: Preheat the oven at about 350 degrees F.
Add the quinoa flour, baking soda and baking powder in a large bowl and sift.

In another bowl, mix together the sugar and coconut oil - you may need to use an electric beater for this. Once the mixture is smooth, add in the egg and beat until creamy. This should take another 2-3 minutes or so. Finally, add the orange or vanilla flavouring.
Then very carefully, fold in the dry ingredients into the wet, until everything is perfectly combined.
Add the nuts to this mixture. If you like, you can put in chocolate chips or another type of nut - it is all up to you.
Onto a baking sheet, plop little scoops of the batter and flatten the top slightly. They will expand once they cook so make sure to leave lots of space between each scoop.

Bake them for about 10 minutes or until the edges become a little hard - they maybe a little underdone, but turn off the oven anyway. Let the cookies cool and harden for a few minutes, then transfer them gently to a wire rack where they will soon be ready to eat.
name: Quinoa Biscuits

description: This tasty yet healthy paneer recipe gives you a fantastic dose of protein and calcium. Not just that, the crunchy bell peppers provide you with Vitamin A, Vitamin C, folate and a punch of antioxidants.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp coriander and green chilli paste
1 cup low fat paneer, cut into cubes
method: Mix all the ingredients of the marinade in a bowl. Combine the paneer, bell pepper cubes, onion cubes and mix into the marinade. Be careful while tossing it and do not mix vigorously otherwise the paneer cubes will break. Set aside for 25-30minutes.
Now start skewering. Place a piece of Bell pepper, onion, 2 paneer cubes and again bell pepper cube on a satay stick.
Repeat the same process and make the rest of the satays.
On a medium flame, place a non-stick pan, grease it with 1/2 tsp oil and place half of the satay sticks on it till the paneer and veggies turn slightly brown in color.
Repeat the same step for the rest of the satays.
Serve fresh with some mint coriander chutney.
name: Paneer Methi Satay

description: Help your taste buds relish your snacks better by using this sweet and peppery accompaniment.
method: Mix all ingredients together and cook till a it gets a little thick.
name: Brown Sauce / Brown Gravy

description: Craving for chaat? Try this healthy sprouts and corn chaat recipe. Loaded with proteins, Vitamin K, dietary fiber, Vitamin C, and Folate, this recipe is a storehouse of nutrients.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp red chilli powder or paprika
A handful pomegranate seeds, to garnish
A handful freshly chopped coriander leaves, to garnish
method: Soak the sprouts overnight and next morning pressure cook it for around 10-15 minutes. Strain well.
Now in as bowl, combine all the ingredients together and serve. Simple to prepare, easy to consume.
name: Mixed Sprouts Corn Chaat

description: Get the basic white sauce right with this recipe.
method: In a heavy-bottomed saucepan, heat the fat, and stir in the flour over low heat.
Saute till there is just a suggestion of brown.
Take the pan off the fire, and add the milk very gradually, stirring vigorously all the time to avoid lumps.
Add enough only to make a thick paste at first.

When
 the paste is smooth and you have ensured that there are no lumps, add 
the rest of the milk very slowly and mix till the milk, flour and fat 
are well blended.
In case lumps do form, strain the mixture.

Place
 the pan over the fire again and stirring all the time, let it come to a
 boil and then simmer for about 4-5 minutes, continuing to stir off and 
on.
Now add the salt and pepper or any other desired seasoning and take it off the heat.
name: White Sauce

description: This mix of five spices is usually used in Chinese cuisine.
method: Toast equal amounts of the spices in a dry pan over a low heat.
Then grind all the spices to a powder.
Store in an air-tight jar.
name: 5 Spice Powder

description: Panada sauce is a thick, milky white sauce which is usually added to bind the batter. It may be used as thickening agent in soups and bakes.
method: Heat the butter/oil for the sauce and add the flour.
Saute over low heat till slightly colored.
Add milk, stirring vigorously all the time, so no lumps form.
Bring to a boil and cook for a minute or so.
Add the salt.
Leave to cool.
name: Panada Sauce

description: Mulagapodi powder is an intense mix of red chillies, coconut and black gram, flavored with tamarind. It is a popular South Indian condiment.
method:
Dry roast the red chillies, Bengal gram, black gram and coconut 
separately till slightly coloured.
Add the salt and tamarind.
Powder this mix and store.
name: Mulagapodi Powder (Gun Powder)

description: Chettinad cuisine from Tamil Nadu is one of spiciest cuisines in India. Use this freshly made fiery masala to liven up your meals.
method: Dry roast and coarsely powder all the ingredients.
name: Chettinad Masala

description: Dhansak masala might seem tedious at first glance but is totally worth the effort! It's a popular dish of the Parsi Zoroastrian community and combines elements of Persian and Gujarati cuisine.
ingredients: 10 gm phool pathar (also known ar kalpasi and dagad phool)
method: Grind all the ingredients together.
Store in an airtight container.
name: Dhansak Masala (Spices for Dhansak)

description: This fiery Goan masala is a blend of hot, aromatic spices, tomatoes, onions and tamarind. Add it to your curries to serve absolutely delectable delicacies.
ingredients: A walnut sized tamarind ball or 1 tsp concentrate
method: Heat oil and add sliced onions.
Let the onions turn brown.
Add tomatoes and fry till the fat separates.
Now add the ground paste and fry till the fat separates again.
Masala is ready.
name: Recheado (Goan Red masala)

description: This incredibly easy pasta salad recipe will get you hooked. Tip in some fresh herbs like parsley and basil for some added flavour, or a dollop of cream for some indulgence.
ingredients: 1 cup broccoli, cut into small pieces
method: Blanch the broccoli in a pan of hot water for 7-8 minutes, and drain well.
Boil the penne until al dante. Run under cold water and drain well.
Heat olive oil in a pan, add garlic and saute for 1-2 minutes. Add the babycorn and saute until slightly brown.
Add the broccoli and toss well for 1-2 minutes. Add seasoning and remove from the flame.
Toss in the pasta, and finish with a shaving of Parmesan on top.
name: Broccoli, Babycorn and Colourful Pasta Salad

description: It can't get simpler than this! Penne tossed with black olives, fresh parsley and Parmesan, for a super quick mid-week lunch.
method: Boil the pasta until al dante. Drain well.
Immediately transfer to a large salad bowl, and add in all the remaining ingredients. Toss well and serve immediately.
name: Parsley and Parmesan Pasta Salad

description: This pickle is a spice lover's dream come true. Whole chillies stuffed with a host of sizzling spices make this Banarasi preparation a popular one.
method: Remove the stalk of the red peppers cutting around the base of the stalk, thus creating an opening to fill them.
Mix together, everything, except the oil and the red peppers.
Add 1/4 cup of the oil and rub it into the mixture.
Stuff this mixture into the red peppers, pressing the filling in firmly, so that it is tightly stuffed.
Dip each red pepper into the oil and place in the container, one by one.
Pour the remainder oil over to cover the red peppers. Keep it under the sun for about a week.
name: Lal Mirch ka Benarsi Achaar

description: A tangy tamarind chutney that can turn around any meal.
method: Soak tamarind in water till soft and pulpy.
Strain and add enough water to make it into a pouring consistency.
Add rest of the ingredients and bring to a boil, then simmer over low heat till it thickens.
Cool and serve.
name: Sonth ki Chutney (Vrat)

description: Bring alive your everyday food with this zingy chutney. A fresh and quirky mixture of basil onions, ginger, coriander and apples.
ingredients: 250 gm apples - peeled, cored and chopped
2 tsp pomegranate mollases or tamarind paste.
method: Put all ingredients in a blender and puree.
Refrigerate and serve.
name: Basil Chutney

description: A jar full of prawns that have been marinated in a spicy mix, and then deep fried to perfection. They'll make the perfect accompaniment to any meal.
ingredients: 1/2 kg prawns, deshelled and deveined (pull out the vein)
method: Marinate the prawns with salt, 2 tsp chilli powder and two spoons of vinegar and refrigerate for 1 hour.
Dry roast fenugreek (
) seeds, powder them and keep aside. Boil the vinegar and keep aside.
Heat oil in a thick bottomed deep pan. Deep fry the prawns and be sure to not overdo them.
In the same oil add the ginger cut into long thin strips.
Saute for a while, add garlic and saute for 2 minutes. Turn off the flame and add chilli powder till the mix turns cold.
Mix the fried prawns, salt and vinegar and wait till the mixture comes to room temperature.
Store in dry glass bottles.
name: Prawn Pickle

description: An unusual sidekick made with brinjals, tomatoes, spices, vinegar and a pinch of sugar.
method: Heat canola oil and add
and
Once it crackles add curry leaves and immediately add the tomatoes. Sauté for a minute.
Add red chilly powder, turmeric powder, salt and sugar. Stir for a minute.
Now add
and cook for 3-4 minutes.
Add vinegar and simmer on slow heat, covered for 2-3 minutes.
Stir again and check for seasoning.
Remove and allow to cool.
name: Baingan Ki Chutney

description: A tangy Caribbean dip made with tomatoes, onions, celery, red chillies, pepper and squeeze of lime. Goes best with a plateful of crunchy crackers.
ingredients: 1 cup or 2 medium red onions finely chopped
5 pimiento stuffed olives cut into slices
method: In a bowl, thoroughly blend together the tomato puree, lime juice, onions, celery, chili pepper, salt, and black pepper.
Stir in the olive slices and sesame seed.
Serve chilled garnished with sprig of coriander leave.
name: Salsa Creole

description: Use this freshly made moulding icing to make your cakes and bakes special.
method: Make a dough with all the ingredients.
Keep covered for 1/2 hour or so.
Proceed to roll or make the flowers.
name: Moulding Icing

description: Buknu is a powered mixture of several spices. It is an ancient recipe, popular in parts of Uttar Pradesh. It is a local hit for rendering a distinct taste to delicacies.
method: Heat oil and saute
and
till a little aroma emanates.
Cool the sauteed ingredients.
Add
salt and
Powder all the ingredients in a blender.
Store in an airtight jar.
name: Buknu

description: This savoury jam with caramelised onions is an absolute treat. Use it in sandwiches, burgers, salads or dips and it will instantly add a boost of flavours.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp brown sugar (more if you prefer sweeter jam)
method: Heat oil and butter in a heavy bottomed pan. Add chilli flakes and herbs and cook for 2 minutes until fragrant.

Throw in the onions, and cook on a low flame for 15 minutes. Once they soften and become translucent, increase the flame to medium, cook for another 10-12 minutes or until they start to turn golden brown.

Add brown sugar, salt, pepper and balsamic vinegar and cook for another 10-15 minutes on a low flame, stirring frequently. Cook until all the water has evaporated and the onions are sticky and dark brown in colour. Remove from the flame.
Once cooled, discard the rosemary sprigs. Transfer to a clean and sterilised glass jar.

Tip:This onion jam should be stored in the refrigerated and consumed within a month. It can be used in wraps, sandwiches, pizzas or add a spoonful of the jam to mayo to make a delicious caramelised onion dip.
name: Onion Jam

description: Ready in a few minutes, this aromatic and flavourful Kashmiri masala can make any curry special.
method: Grind all ingredients at high speed for 3 minutes.
You should obtain a fine powder which can be sieved and stored in an airtight container.
name: Kashmiri Garam Masala

description: Cherry and Ginger? Sounds odd right? It tastes the opposite. Don't miss out on this refreshing drink this summer from the house of Yauatcha, Mumbai
method: Take a highball glass.
Add ice cubes.
Shake all the ingredients in the tin.
Strain it over fresh ice.
Strain the contents into the serving glass (over fresh ice).
Garnish with ginger and cherry in prisma.
name: Cherry and Ginger Ice Tea

description: Coriander chutney is common to most Indian households but this recipe will blow your mind! The overpowering taste of coriander is beautifully balanced with mint leaves and a few drops of lemon juice.
method: Place all the ingredients in a blender and blend well.Add a little water only if required to ease blending or grind the ingredients on a grinding stone.
name: Coriander Chutney (Hare Dhaniye ki Chutney)

description: This tangy chutney can brighten up a boring meal. Made with raw mangoes, chillies, cumin, sugar and salt, it will leave your taste buds tingling.
ingredients: 1 kg mango- raw, peeled, shredded and discard seed
method: Mix all ingredients together and sun for a few days.
Stir off and on, till sugar dissolves and gets sticky. This should take about 5-7 days.
name: Chhunddo (Mango Chutney)

description: This spiced lemon pickle can work wonders for your boring meals.
ingredients: 2 kg lemons, washed, wiped and chopped
100 gm chilli powder or to taste
50 gm fenugreek seeds (methi dana), finely ground
method: Heat 60 gm (1 cup) oil and add the lemons and saute for about 10 minutes over low heat.
Add salt and chilli powder, saute for another 10 minutes
Add fenugreek seeds, asafoetida and turmeric and the remaining oil, bring to a boil, lower the heat and cook for 10 minutes.
Take it off the heat and store in a clean airtight jar when cool.
Gets softer when matured for 10-15 days.
name: South Indian Lemon Pickle

description: A sweet and sour pickle made with gooseberries. Gooseberries are a great source of Vitamin C.
ingredients: 240 gm/1 cup sarson ka tel (mustard oil)
method: Boil the amla till the skin looks tender (about 15 minutes).
Leave to drain in a colander till all the water drains out.
Heat some oil and add the mustard seeds, heeng and chilli powder.
Mix well and add the amla and salt.
Stir fry till it's mixed well and the amlas are completely coated with masala.
Cool and store in a clean jar.
name: Amle ka Achaar (Gooseberry Relish)

description: Home-made ghee is pure, healthy and delicious. Use this easy recipe to master the art of making desi ghee.
method: Bring milk to boil, leave it to cool for 4-5 hours.
This forms a thick layer of cream
over the top, remove this layer and keep aside. The milk can be then used as skimmed milk for any purpose.
Keep collecting the layered cream for 5-6 days. Refrigerate the cream collected everyday.
For extracting ghee take the cream collected over a period, add double the quantity of water, mix and whip till a froth floats on top.
Separate the froth and heat it on low flame in a thick bottom saucepan till the fat separates into clarified ghee, strain and store for use.
name: Desi Ghee

description: A chunky chutney recipe made with eggplants, mustard oil, vinegar, cinnamon, chillies and a hint of sugar.
ingredients: 1 kg brinjals/eggplants - cut into small cubes
method: Grind the cardamoms, cloves, cinnamon and cumin seeds to a fine powder.
Heat the oil and brown the onions and ginger-garlic paste in it.
Add the brinjals and saute over high heat till brown.

Add
 sugar, salt, chilli powder and garam masala and cook to a thick 
consistency, adding a little water to make it soft and mushy if 
necessary.
Add the vinegar and simmer for about 5 minutes.
When cool, pack in a sterilised airtight jar and store.
name: Baingan Chutney

description: Hot and spicy Mexican barbeque sauce with an innovative addition of beer to it. Serve it along with your meals to jazz up the usual, regular affair.
method: Heat oil in a sauce pan.
Saute onion until lightly browned.
Add garlic, chilli, salt and tomatoes.
Let it simmer until the mixture thickens.
Add the remaining sauce ingredients.
Cook for about ten minutes, keep stirring.
Put out the heat, let it cool.
Store as required and serve.
name: Mexican Barbeque Sauce

description: A refreshing chutney made with coconut and coriander.
method: Grind all the ingredients together to a fine paste.
Can be stored in a dry jar and refrigerated for a few days.
name: Hare Nariyal ki Chutney

description: A smooth and tangy spread made with grapefruits.
method: Squeeze the juice of the grapefruit and lemons.
Cook the juice along with water over a moderate flame.
Remove membrane, pips and pith from the fruit and tie securely inside a muslin bag.
Shred peel into strips and add to the juice along with the muslin bag.
Cook juice until the liquid has evaporated by 1/3.
Add sugar and dissolve.
Boil rapidly until setting point is reached.
Drop in butter and skim out any impurities from the surface.
Store in a cool and dry jar.
Scoop out a teaspoonful and spread it on a slice of toast.
name: Grapefruit Marmalade

description: A spoonful of this delightful mixture into a glass of plain milk and you'll have a healthier and much tastier drink.
ingredients: 100 gm almonds, shelled and coarsely powdered
method: Mix all the ingredients and store in an airtight jar.
Use 1 tsp of the
for 1 cup of milk along with sugar to taste.
name: Masala for Milk

description: An easy recipe to make chicken stock at home.
ingredients: 250 gm bones of chicken (can be combination of bones and left-over chicken)
method: Place all the ingredients in a pressure cooker and cook for about 15 minutes.
Strain the soup and season according to taste, and use any flesh that is there for sandwiches or salads.
name: Chicken Stock

description: A creamy dipping sauce made with mayonnaise. Usually used with sea food, this dip is  loaded with flavor.
method: Mix all the ingredients together and serve.
name: Tartare Sauce

description: A delectable pork broth made using the bones, it is flavoured with seaweed and a handful of vegetables and slow cooked for hours for the flavours to develop.
method: Fill a large enough cooking pot with water and bring to boil.
Switch off fire as soon as the water boils. Drop in the bones and let cool. This process will help you get rid of the blood and blood vessels easily.
Drain the water off the bones in a large strainer and discard the water.
Check and take off any blood or blood vessels from the bones and wash them under running water.
Break all the bones in two with a hammer. Leave it to cool down for 30-40 minutes.
Fill the pot again with clear water and place a wire mesh beneath and drop the bones inside. Bring to boil.
Keep cooking over a strong fire and scoop out foam and unwanted matters coming up on the surface
As the bottom might get hotter than near the surface, stir with a large ladle from time to time.

Continue to boil the broth for 24 hours, or until desired consistency and colour is reached, meat has completely separated and broken down in the broth. Add all vegetables one by one and further boil for 10 more hours. Optionally, you can stir every 1-2 hours just to check up on things and promote more churning.
Add water if the level gets too low. Once cooked to your liking, strain the broth, discarding the solids, and reserve broth by quickly chilling with ice.

Retain the balance quantity by freezing it in food grade plastic bags and ones you wish to use again, simply cut open the plastic bag and dump the frozen stock lump in a cooking pot and place it over heat to melt/defrost .
Flavour it with soy sauce and bonito flakes.
name: Cha Shu Broth

description: A simple and easy recipe to making the soft, white and creamy mayonnaise sauce. Use this sauce as a dressing for salads or in your sandwiches or burgers or as a dip.
ingredients: 1/8 tsp pissi kali mirch (powdered black pepper)
method: Break egg into the jar of a blender (liquidizer/blender).
Add the vinegar, salt, pepper, mustard or mustard oil and sugar.
Switch on blender at full speed, and immediately add the oil in a thin stream, with the blender on, all the time, till the required consistency is reached.
This is like thick cream.
As soon as it is thick enough, switch it off and your mayonnaise is ready.
This makes about one cup of mayonnaise sauce.
Note: In case it curdles, just empty the jar, break another egg into the jar, start the blender and immediately but slowly add the curdled mixture to the jar till well blended.
name: Mayonnaise Sauce (Blender)

description: Beauty expert Suparna Trikha prepares an organic hair tonic that will strengthen your hair and keep it gleaming.
method: Take a pan and add water. Let it simmer.
Now add all the other ingredients and bring it to a boil.
Cover it and let it brew till it turns a pinking green hue. Allow it to rest.
Strain it once it cools down.
name: Hair Tonic

description: A BBQ sauce with a twist! This one has a strong cola flavor. Try out something different.
ingredients: 1/2 cup cola (You can use any black soft drink)
method: In a food processor /
add onion, tomato, green chilli, chilli flakes, tomato ketchup, jalapeno chilli, Tabasco, soy sauce. Give it a mix. Keep aside.
In a saucepan add white wine vinegar and sugar. Let it reduce by half. Then add the tomato-onion mix. Let it simmer.
Add cola and let it cook for 10 minutes.
BBQ cola sauce is ready!
Apply it on sausages or prawns, char grill them. Serve!
name: Cola BBQ Sauce

description: Beauty expert Suparna Trikha prepares makes a soft exfoliating scrub for your skin.
method: Take all the ingredients together in a small bowl and mulsh them together to form a paste. Store in the fridge to cool.
name: Summer Exfoliating Scrub

description: Satisfyingly crisp and crunchy, make this much loved Indian snack at home. Aloo papads are popularly made during the festival of Holi.
ingredients: Salt and Chilli powder to taste
Oil to grease while rolling plastic sheet to help roll.
method: Mix in the mashed potatoes, oil, salt and chilli powder.
Knead like a dough till smooth and glossy.
Take small portions of this mixture and roll as thin as possible, on to the plastic sheet, greasing if it sticks.
Dry in the sun, store in airtight containers.
name: Aloo ka Papad

description: Chutney made with the goodness of plums infused with warm flavours of cinnamon, chillies and cloves.
method: Place plums in a glass or steel vessel and cover with water. Leave overnight.
Next morning, rub the mixture and remove seeds.
Add sugar, salt, chilli powder cinnamon and cloves and heat over low heat, stirring all the time to dissolve the sugar.
Increase the heat and bring to a boil and let cook till thick. A drop dropped in cool water should set.
Add the vinegar and simmer for about 5 minutes.
When cool, pack in an airtight clean jar and store.
name: Plum Chutney

description: A super quick, super easy chutney recipe made with mint leaves, cumin seeds, onions and yogurt. Relish this perfect sidekick for your starters!
ingredients: 100 gm fresh mint leaves and tender stalks
method: Chop the tender stalks and the mint leaves roughly.
Grind all the ingredients together, except the yoghurt, to form a smooth paste.
Mix the yoghurt into the
And serve.
name: Pudine ki Chutney

description: A popular dip from Middle East made with Chef Vicky Ratnani's inventive twist. This one is made with green peas, tahini paste, olives, mustard and lemon juice.
ingredients:
1 cup green peas 
1/2 cup green olives
1 1/2 tsp pistachios
                         
1 tsp garlic
                            
1 green chilli
                    
2 Tbsp tahini paste                  

1/2 cup olive oil
                       
1 Tbsp lemon juice
1 Tbsp mustard
                                     
Salt & pepper to taste
method: Add a cup of green peas, green chillies, green olives, garlic, pistachios, salt & pepper, tahini paste, lemon juice, mustard and some olive oil.
Blend it well to a chunky paste.
It tastes great on toast, crackers and with some raw veggie batons such as carrots & radishes.
name: Spicy Green Pea & Olive Hummus

description: Ditch the mangoes and lemons that have traditionally been packed in pickle jars, here is a new kid on the block - drumsticks. Don't give this one a miss!
method: Scrape the drumsticks and cut as desired.
Steam them for 5 minutes.
Make a fine paste of methi, sarson, red chilies and tamarind.
Heat oil and add garlic, ground ingredients, heeng, salt and haldi.
Mix well and add drumsticks.
Cook on low flame for 5 minutes. Take it off the stove and cool.
Then add vinegar and sesame oil.
Transfer into a clean jar.
Keep the preparation refrigerated for at least 3 days before serving.
name: Drumstick Pickle

description: Ever thought of mutton being pickled? Here we have the tang, spice and acetous sourness of achaar playing well with juicy meat.
ingredients: 2 kg mutton, cut into curry style pieces
1 cup red chilli powder or as required
method: Place the oil to heat in a large kadahi or pan
Keep the heat on high
Add ginger and garlic
Stir fry till light golden brown.
Add meat and continue stirring over high heat
Lower the heat and cook covered till the meat is tender.
Uncover and cook over high heat till fat separates.
Add the powdered spices, salt and mix well
Cook again over high heat, then add vinegar.
Let it come to a boil, then turn off the heat.
Let it cool down completely.
Transfer to a sterilized glass canning jar and store it in the refrigerator
name: Gosht Ka Achaar

description: Fresh and juicy shrimps pickled in malt vinegar and a host of spices.
method: Mix oil and red chillies.
Cook covered at high heat for 2 minutes.
Mix in the ginger-garlic paste
Cook uncovered at high heat for 3 minutes.
Add shrimps. Mix and cook uncovered at high heat for 7 minutes, stir once.
Mix in chilli powder, turmeric, salt, vinegar
Cook covered at 70% for 7 minutes.
Add achaar masala and mix well
Cool and serve.
Transfer into a clean, sterile airtight jar and refrigerate.
name: Jhinga Achaar

description: Indian gooseberries cooked in sugar syrup flavoured with cardamom. A sweet alternative to pickles.
method: Prick amla with a fork. Dissolve 1 tsp lime in water and soak amla overnight.
Remove and wash well. Repeat once more.
Drain and wash thoroughly.
Squeeze and rinse to eliminate lime remains.
Boil water then add amla.
Cook till tender and transparent.
Drain and keep aside.
Make syrup with sugar, lemon juice and 6 cups of water.
Maintain one thread consistency, skimming off any scum that keeps forming.
Add amla, bring to a boil and simmer for 4-5 minutes.
Let it cool, then store in a clean airtight jar.
You can add elaichi or any other flavoring of your choice.
name: Amla Murabba

description: An extremely simple and easy to make Turkish accompaniment to your main dish.
method: Add all ingredients and whip well.
Yogurt mezze is ready to serve.
name: Turkish Yogurt Mezze

description: This creamy sauce made from an emulsion of egg yolk is an absolute essential for Eggs Benedict. It also goes beautifully with fresh steamed asparagus or other spring vegetables.
method: Melt the butter and keep it warm.
Heat the vinegar or lemon juice until warm.
Meanwhile keep a small saucepan with boiling water and a measuring Tbsp ready.

Place the top of a double boiler over (not in) hot water. (This means the bottom of the top of the double boiler sound not make contact with the water heating in the bottom half of the double boiler.)
Place the egg yolks in the top of a double boiler and whisk until they begin to thicken.
Now add 1 Tbsp of the boiling water.
Continue to beat the sauce until it begins to thicken.
Repeat with the remaining water, one Tbsp at a time, beating the mixture after each addition.
Now add the warmed vinegar or lemon juice. Remove the double boiler from the heat.
Beat the sauce briskly with a wire whisk. Continue to beat the mixture as you slowly pour in the melted butter.
Add the salt and cayenne and beat the sauce until it is thick. Serve immediately.
name: Hollandaise Sauce

description: This creamy Boursin -style spread is absolutely addictive and delicious on your favorite crackers or bread. It is also absolutely fantastic in a sandwich and great with crudities.
ingredients: 1 cup raw cashew nut (not roasted or salted)
Himalayan sea salt or other unrefined mineral salt, to taste
Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
Filtered water/ Soy milk if required
method: Soak the raw cashews in warm filtered water (just enough to cover them) for at least  2 hours with a dash of sea salt. (4-6 hours of soaking in warm water or overnight is also okay.)
Pour out the water from the cashews and rinse with fresh water.
Add the cashews and other ingredients to a grinder/blender.
Process until you get a thick but creamy spread.
Add Water/Soya milk if needed.
Put  into a glass container, cover, and keep in the fridge overnight for all the flavours to mingle.
It should stay good for 5-6 days after that if refrigerated.
Enjoy with crackers/bread as a dip accompanied by some raw veggies or right off the spoon.
Omit herbs and garlic and use more pepper.
Use shallots instead of garlic.
To the basic mixture, add 1 teaspoon dried basil or any other favourite herb or use 1 tablespoon chopped fresh herbs.
To the basic mixture, add 2 tablespoons chopped roasted red pepper or sun-dried tomato with onions.
To the basic mixture,add de-seeded green chilli and coriander/parsley.
name: Creamy Boursin-style Spread

description: Who would have thought that hummus could be made without chickpeas? Reshma Khattar Bhagat shows you how to make a healthy zucchini hummus.
method: Combine zucchini, almonds, lemon juice, garlic, onion powder, cumin, tahini, salt and pepper in the food processor till smooth.
Add olive oil and pulse it again.
Now add the parsley in the end and finish with a quick pulse.
Garnish with some parsley.
Serve with crackers.
name: Zucchini Hummus

description: The perfect accompaniment to a full fledged Punjabi meal. This Punjabi style mango pickle is made with whole spices and stored in mustard oil.
ingredients: 2 1/2 kg mango, chopped into desired size
method: Mix all the spices together and add half a cup of oil to the mix. Sprinkle a little of this mixture into the jar.
Take some mangoes and rub them well in the spice mixture. Put one layer of the mangoes in the jar and sprinkle some more spice mixture on top.
Keep repeating the layering process with a sprinkle of mixture till the mangoes are used up. Put all the remaining mixture on top of these layers.
Add the rest of the oil to the jar until its contents are covered. Keep in the sun for a week then store. The contents will be very tender in a month.
Serve with your favorite parantha!
name: Aam Ka Achaar

description: Indulge in some culinary magic as Aditya Bal and Devanshi fuse traditional ingredients with western influences keeping in mind the health quotient. A Mexican salsa with corn, coriander and chat masala.
method: In a bowl mix the sweet corn, onion and jalapenos.
Squeeze the juice of a lemon.
Add to that chilli flakes, salt and coriander.
Now add the chaat masala, cumin powder.
Mix well.
Serve it with baked corn tortilla chips.
name: Spicy Corn Salsa

description: Whip up a quick yogurt side dish with some green chillies thrown in for that extra kick.
ingredients: A handful of fresh coriander leaves, chopped fine
method: In a bowl mix the yogurt, salt, coriander leave and green chillies.
Serve chilled.
name: Green Chilly Raita

description: Serve these sweet and tangy grilled pineapple rings with some grilled chicken and you're sorted. Perfect-o!
method: Slather the
well onto the pineapple rings.
Grill for 10 minutes or till golden brown.
name: Grilled Pineapples

description: An innovative dip made with grilled bell peppers, garbanzo beans, chillies and garlic. Serve with freshly cut vegetables, pita bread or crackers.
method: Wash and grill the bell pepper.
In a blender add all the ingredients together. Give it a whiz. Please note that the lemon, garlic, Thai chillies and salt may vary according to your taste.
Dip or spread on pita bread, whole-wheat crackers, trader Joe's savory thin mini edamame crackers, celery, carrots and cucumbers.
name: Bell Pepper and Bean Dip

description: A dip that is hearty and full of flavours. This dip recipe is simple and fast, use it as a starter or for a dip with salads.
method: Heat the pan and add 6 tsp of olive oil and add garlic, onion and green chilli. Then season it with salt.
Take a roasted aubergine and scope out some of its flesh. Peel off the skin and chop the aubergine.
Add the aubergine to the pan and season with salt and coriander seeds.
Mash it with fork.
Add chilli powder and let it cook for some time.
Finish it off with juice of 1/2 lime and let the mixture cool down.
Then in a bowl add some coriander leaves & curd and mix it.
Add aubergine mixture to it and mix it all well.
Cut 1 cucumber in halves and de-seed it.
Fill the cucumber boat with aubergine dip.
name: Roasted Aubergine Dip

description: A top favorite munch, oven toasted multi-grain bread lathered with a garlic and butter.
method: Pre-heat the pan.
Chop 5 garlic cloves.
Cut 3-4 thick slices of multi-grain bread.
Add 4 Tbsp of butter into the hot pan.
Add chopped garlic and 1 tsp chili flakes. Mix well.
Turn off the heat and let it cool down. Transfer to a bowl.
Spread the garlic butter on the bread slices and put in the oven at 150 degrees for 2 to 3 minutes till the bread turns golden brown.
name: Multi-Grain Garlic Bread

description: A sidekick that is sweet and sour in one bite! Made with dry mango powder, jaggery and spices.
method: Boil the amchoor in water and leave aside.
Heat oil in a handi and add the roasted cumin seeds, kalonji and the rest of the masalas and in the end the amchoor.
Crush the jaggery into pieces and add to the mixture. Add a little water.
Cook till the jaggery dissolves and the liquid thickens.
name: Amchoor ki Launji

description: This pickle is a perfect accompaniment with your meals during winters. Make it once and store it for weeks!
method: Peel the carrots, and cut them into 7cm/3" pieces, not too thin (about finger size, you can say).
Mix all ingredients together, and put the mixture into a clean jar with a tight lid.
Leave in the sun for about a week and shake the bottle once a day to mix well.
name: Gajar ka Achaar

description: A coconut based masala that is guaranteed to make an ordinary curry interesting.
method: Roast all the ingredients except coconut and coriander seeds in oil. Keep aside.
Roast coconut and coriander seeds separately without oil.
Now
grind all these items together.
Let it cool and store in an airtight container.
name: Maharashtrian Goda Masala

description: Khaboos is an Iranian or Arabic flat-bread made with maida. Goes well with stews, hummus or dips.
method: Sift the flour along with the salt and the soda, and knead it to a soft, smooth dough, with the yoghurt.
Cover with a damp cloth, and leave to rise in a warm, draught free place.
If in a hurry, place the dough container in a larger container of hot water, covered with a damp cloth, of course. Takes about 2 hours to rise.
Punch the dough and leave to rise again.
This time it will take much less time.
Knead the dough a little before breaking it up into walnut sized pieces.
Smoothen these into round balls, cover with a damp cloth and leave thus, for at least 15 minutes.
Roll the balls into flat oval or round shapes, stretching and pulling with your hands when required.
When all are rolled thus, dampen the surface with water or milk, and sprinkle the onion seeds over them.
Bake these in a preheated oven, on a greased baking tray for about 5 minutes.
Better still, is to grill them if your griller has elements both above and below.
Of course, if you have a clay oven tandoor, wet the lower surface with water and stick it to the walls of the tandoor.
To make the naan tastier, brush it with melted butter or 'ghee' as soon as it comes out of the oven.
name: Khaboos

description: Citrus flavored butter makes a simple slice of bread delicious.
ingredients: 1 green chilli - deseeded and chopped   coarsely
method: Beat the butter, lime, chilli and pepper  together.
name: Spiced Butter

description: Re-constitute this mix of poppy seeds, almonds and rose petals. Mixed with milk for a refreshing summer cooler.
method: Grind all the ingredients together.
Mix with milk and serve chilled.
name: Thandai / Sardai Mixture

description: Lemon and garlic flavoured oil dressing for salads.
method: Mix all the ingredients together and use.
French dressing can be made and kept in a screw-topped bottle for future use.
Always shake the bottle well before use.
name: French Dressing

description: Make homemade chicken stock to use in a variety of dishes.
method: Put in a pressure cooker till the chicken is cooked.
Then let it sit for at least half in hour.
Drain the chicken and all else, and you have fresh homemade stock.
name: Fresh Chicken Stock

description: A savory jam that goes perfect on the side with meat or toasts.
method: Saute sliced onions in oil until soft.
Add remaining ingredients and cook for an hour. Re-season.
Cool and store in a clean and dry jar.
Serve on toast / canapes or as an accompaniment with cold cuts.
name: Onion Marmalade

description: Khoya is used mainly for making Indian sweets like barfis and gulab jamun.
method: Bring the milk to boil in the
and then simmer over low heat.
Stir to avoid scorching till the milk thickens and collects together in a solid mass.
name: Khoya

description: Homemade mayonnaise is handy to use in sandwich fillings, salad dressings or sauce bases.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp mustard powder or mustard oil
method: In a deep bowl, break the eggs. Add to it the vinegar, sugar, salt, mustard and pepper.  Beat these ingredients together, till fairly thick.
Now add 1 tbsp of oil and continue beating till well blended and a little thickened.
Add another tbsp and follow the same procedure, repeating till all the oil has been used up.
At the end of using the whole cup of oil, the mayonnaise should reach the required thick and creamy consistency, leaving a light trail.
name: Mayonnaise

description: Try your hand at making unsalted white butter (Safeed makhan) at home.
ingredients: (Malai is the fat obtained from milk)
method: Take
in a small bowl at room temperature.
Take a bigger bowl and add ice cubes to it. Place the small bowl with malai on top of these ice cubes.
Beat well till the butter floats on top.
Let it stand for 15-20 minutes. The butter will solidify.
Skim the butter and leave the liquid.
This butter is unsalted and usually white in color.
name: White Butter

description: Stop buying the packaged yogurt that are full of preservatives. Learn how to make smooth and creamy yogurt at home.
method: Boil the milk and transfer it into the container in which the yoghurt is to be set. A ceramic bowl is best.
Cool the milk to a luke warm temperature-a drop of it on your wrist, should feel neither hot nor cold. The temperature of the milk is important.
Beat the teaspoonful of yoghurt till smooth, add 2 Tbsp milk to it and mix well. Add this to the rest of the milk and stir with a spoon to mix well.
Cover the container and keep in a draught-free place to set.
Do not move the container while the yoghurt is setting.
Once set, place the yoghurt in the refrigerator to chill before serving.
name: Yogurt

description: Learn how to make the age old garam masala at home. Roasted spices ground together to make a aromatic masala.
method: Sun all ingredients or place them over an oven to rid them of any moisture.
Then grind them to a powder in a food processor.
Store in an airtight jar.
name: Garam Masala

description: A basic recipe of how to make soft cottage cheese at home. Cube it, fry it, crumble it and enjoy in the dishes of your choice.
method: Boil the milk, lower heat and add lime juice, stirring till the milk begins to curdle.
When the whey is clear, stop adding the solution, shut off the heat and leave for about 5 minutes.
Drain curdled milk through a cloth and leave to set for an hour or so.
They whey left behind is very nutritious and can be used for gravies, rice, lentils.
In case you live in the West, or somewhere where the milk is very rich, use a less fatty milk, or else the
will not hold its shape
name: Paneer or Cottage Cheese

description: Sprinkle this chaat masala on top of your tikki, bhalle, papri, bhelpuri and get an instant boost in the flavor of the chaat.
ingredients: 1/2 cup dried and powdered mint leaves
method: Roast the coriander, cumin and ajwain in a heavy-based pan till dark brown.
Remove from pan and leave to cool.
Put all the ingredients together and powder fine, in a processor.
Store in an airtight jar.
name: Chaat Masala

description: Authentic yellow curry paste used in a wide variety of dishes. Store in an airtight container.
ingredients: lime leaves - snipped into small pieces with scissors
method: Place all ingredients in a blender and blend well to a paste.
Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to two weeks (or longer).
To use right away, place paste in a wok with some vegetable oil.
Stir fry until fragrant (about one minute), then add some coconut milk plus some more lemongrass stalk.
Add meat, chicken or tofu or vegetables and cook till tender.
name: Thai Yellow Curry Paste

description: Thai red curry paste plays an indispensable part in several recipes.
method: Grind all the ingredients in a mortar or a food processor using a little water.
Store in an airtight container or in the refrigerator.
Alternatively, freeze for upto 3 months. Use as required.
name: Thai Red Curry Paste

description: Tandoori masala made quickly. Sprinkle it on top of prepared tandoori dishes or add it in the marinade to make the dish more aromatic.
method: Mix all the ingredients, blend in a blender and  store in an air-tight jar.
name: Tandoori Masala

description: Let the aroma of freshly baked bread spread in your house. Soft and light, this bread recipe will not disappoint you.
ingredients: Lukewarm water to knead dough (too hot will kill yeast)
1 tsp dry yeast or 10 gm compressed (Frozen) yeast
1 egg, slightly beaten with 1 Tbsp (15 g) milk and 1/4 tsp salt
Note: In case you do not want to use egg, use 1/4 cup milk and salt mixture.
method: Dissolve sugar in 1/2 cup lukewarm water (should be body temperature, i.e. when put on the wrist, should not feel warm or cold).

Sprinkle dry yeast over it or blend the frozen yeast into the water. Leave this solution in a draught-free place to froth. Should take about 10 minutes. In case it does not, it means that your yeast is ineffective, hence change your packet.

Sieve the flour, add salt and rub in the oil. Make a well in the centre of the flour; pour the yeast mixture and some of the water into it. Start mixing the flour and liquid together, adding liquid little by little till smooth and soft.

Knead the dough on a floured surface for at least 10 minutes--fold dough towards yourself, then push down and away with the heels of the palms. Continue till the dough feels firm and elastic and no longer sticky.
Place dough in a deep vessel, well dusted with flour, and cover vessel with cling film or a thick damp cloth. Keep in a draught-free place to rise.

When dough rises (about an hour in warm weather and 2-3 hours in cooler climate and about 45 minutes if using the warm water technique), punch it and knead a little before leaving it to rise again. The second rise will take a much shorter time. To test the dough, press lightly into the dough with a finger, and if the impression fills up soon, it is done.

After the second rising, roll dough out flat, about 1/4 cm (1/8") thick, and then roll it like a scroll. Fold the two ends of the roll towards each other, making them meet in the centre. Place the dough in the tin, folded side down. The dough should not fill more than half the tin.

Brush with egg mixture and leave to rise once again. When the dough doubles (about 15 minutes), bake in a pre-heated oven, placing a bowl of hot water at the bottom (to humidify the baking atmosphere). Bake for about 30-40 minutes, or until brown and the loaf leaves the sides of the tin. Remove from the oven and place inverted on a wire rack to cool. If you want a soft top, place on a thick cloth like a folded towel instead of the rack.
name: Plain White Bread

description: Give your tea a twist with this chai masala. Make it once and use it for months. Water, milk, sugar and this chai masala for a flavorsome tea.
method: Grind and store in an airtight jar.
name: Chai ka Masala (Spice Mixture for Tea)

description: A dash of lemon keeps the rice grains from getting soggy. Steamed rice can be served with any gravy dish.
method: Clean the rice and wash well till the water is clear.
Soak the rice in 2 cups of water for at least 1/2 hour.
In a heavy bottomed pan, put the rice and water over high heat and bring to a boil, adding the lemon juice also.
Once it comes to a boil, cover, and let it simmer over low heat, till cooked through, and the water is absorbed.
Takes about 10 minutes. Serve hot.
name: Steamed Rice

description: Caramel is used as a flavoring agent in ice creams, puddings, cakes and candies.
method: Place 1 cup of sugar and 1/2 cup of water in a pan and heat over low heat.
When the sugar melts, it will gradually get darker.
When dark and almost bubbly, the caramel is ready.
name: Caramel

description: Apples stewed with a little water to make some baby food. Add a pinch of cinnamon and some brown sugar to turn it into a delicious dessert.
method: Put peeled and chopped apples in a heavy-bottomed saucepan, with a little bit of water (to just about form a thin layer at the bottom of the pan), cover and cook over low heat till some of the juices are drawn, and the bottom becomes liquidy.
Remove lid and let any excess liquid dry up, taking care not to let the apples burn.
Apples can also be stewed in a pressure cooker.
name: Stewed Apples

description: Dip made with the goodness of dried figs blended in the flavors of malt and white vinegar, chillies and garlic.
method: Heat the oil in a small frying pan.
Fry the onion and garlic in the oil until golden brown. Set aside.
Place the remaining ingredients in a blender with the fried onions and garlic and whiz to a smooth, thick paste.
Chill for at least 30 minutes before serving.
The chutney can be stored in an airtight, non-metallic container in the refrigerator for upto 1 month.
name: Fig Chutney

description: A creamy yogurt based dip with the crunchiness of onions and peanuts. Tempered with mustard seeds.
method: In a bowl, whip the yogurt until it is creamy.
Fold in the onion, tomato, green chilli, and salt.
Heat the oil in a small frying pan, then add the mustard seeds.
Fry for a few seconds until you can smell the aroma, then tip in the peanuts, if using.
Fry for a minute, making sure they don't burn.
When the mixture has cooled gently add it to the yogurt.
Serve chilled.
name: Yogurt Dip

description: This adrak ka achaar is super easy and quick. Very popular during the festival of Navratras.
method: Peel and julienne ginger.
In a jar add ginger, salt, vinegar and lemon juice. Shake the jar vigorously.
Let the achaar rest for an hour.
When the ginger is a little pink, it means the pickle is ready to eat.
It is perfect to consume this achaar during the festival of
name: Adrak ka Achaar (Ginger Pickle)

description: A dip made with the refreshing and pleasing flavors of coriander, avocado, parsley, yogurt and lemon juice.
ingredients: 1 pinch fine sea salt and freshly ground black pepper
method: Place the garlic, shallot, avocado, parsley, coriander, olive oil, yogurt and lemon juice in a blender or food processor and blend until smooth.
Season with sea salt and freshly ground pepper.
name: Coriander Relish

description: Pita bread served with three cool and refreshing dips: beetroot, yogurt and carrot. This middle eastern food is a light and healthy option for you.
method: Blend the boiled beetroots into a fine paste.
To the beetroot paste add curd, grated garlic, lemon juice, olive oil and mix them all together.
Drizzle some olive oil and garnish with olives and chopped mint.
Season to taste.
In a salad bowl, take yogurt, lemon juice, olive oil, mint, parsley, salt, pepper and cumin powder.
Mix all the ingredients together to make the labneh.
Heat butter in a pan; add some olive oil and grated carrots.
In a flat plate, take yogurt, add garlic, salt, pepper and olive oil then add cooked carrots to the yogurt mix.
Top with chopped parsley and olive oil.
Serve Pita bread with the three refreshing dips.
name: Pita Bread with Dips

description: A pineapple chutney, that's chunky, sweet and sour in one bite. You can alter the spice quotient in this pachadi by going easy on the chillies.
method: Cook pineapple with green chillies, ginger, salt and 1/2 cup water, till the pineapple is soft and mushy in texture. Take out the ginger at this stage.
Grind the coconut and red chillies to a paste. Then add the crushed mustard seeds. Mix these with the cooked pineapple. Let it boil, then remove from the flame.
Add beaten curd and mix well.
Heat oil in a pan and splutter whole mustard seeds. Add red chillies and curry leaves. Pour this seasoning over the cooked pineapple. Mix well.
Serve with appams and stew.
name: Pineapple Pachadi

description: Potli ka achaar is common in most Sindhi households. This recipe has been passed down for generations in my family. Goes perfect with some aloo ke tuk, Sindhi curry, papad and boiled rice.
ingredients: 2 bulbs of garlic, peeled but whole
1 meter mulmul ka kapda/ muslin cloth cut into small squares of around 4x4 inches
method: Grate the raw mangoes.
Mix it well with salt, chillies, turmeric, kalongi, garlic and mustard oil.
Cut the cloth into small squares.
Put the achaar mix into it and tie it like a small potli. Make all the potlis like this.
Put them in a nice clean jar and pour 1/2 cup vinegar over it.
Keep it in indirect sunlight for 4-5 days and its ready to eat
If you wish to preserve it for longer time then keep the jar in the fridge.
Add the oil as it is, do not heat it or the color of the achaar would darken.
name: Potli Ka Achaar

description: Garma garam khaane ke saath thandi thandi chutney. This mooli ki chutney goes best with piping hot Kashmiri food.
ingredients: 5 Tbsp hung curd (Hung curd is normal curd that has been removed of all the water content)
method: Grate the radish and squeeze it lightly to remove the excess water content.
In a bowl mix all the ingredients together.
Store it in the fridge. Serve the chutney chilled.
name: Mooli Ki Chutney

description: A beautiful looking beetroot raita. With the crunch of cucumbers and onions, this pink colored raita is best served chilled with hot paranthas or pulao.
method: In a blender add the curd and  beetroot puree. Mix. Strain in a bowl. Should be pink in color.
Add the chopped onions, cucumbers and salt to the bowl. Mix.
Garnish it with chopped coriander leaves.
name: Beetroot Raita

description: A delectable pate with porcini, shitake and oyster mushrooms. Served with grilled pita bread or crackers.
ingredients: 3-4 Tbsp mushroom stock, from the re-hydrated mushrooms
1 Tbsp of dried porcini mushrooms, re-hydrated in hot water
1 Tbsp of dried shitake mushrooms, re-hydrated in hot water
1 Tbsp of dried oyster mushrooms, re-hydrated in hot water
A pinch of cracked black pepper
method: In a pan, sweat the minced onions and garlic on a medium  flame in 1 tbsp of olive oil.
Add the sliced mushrooms and the hydrated mushrooms. Saute well.
Add the cumin seeds and a dash of the mushroom stock and fry for a few minutes till it is light brown and the juices have reduced.
De-glaze with balsamic vinegar.
Season the mushrooms with salt, white and black pepper.
Cook for another 2 to 3 minutes then set aside to cool.
In a food processor, add the walnuts, sauteed mushrooms, mustard, grated Parmesan cheese, rosemary, 2 tbsp of olive oil and melted butter and blend till it turns into a thick paste.
Garnish the pate with rosemary and a drizzle of olive oil.
Serve with crackers or grilled pita bread.
name: Mushroom Pate

description: A sour chutney with the goodness of amla, saunf and bhrami leaves.
method: In a pan take some oil and add
in it.
Add boiled pieces of
. Toss.
Add
powder, red chilli powder and
. Cook for a minute. Now add
and salt. Let it cool.
Blend it in a mixer and serve.
name: Amla Chutney

description: Spice of winter. A spicy pickle of mixed vegetables, which is sweet and sour too.
ingredients: 750 gm gajar (carrots), scraped and cut into pieces
60 gm ginger, peeled and chopped, coarsely pounded
20 gm chilli powder or to taste
method: Place the oil to heat in a large kadahi (or wok) and the vinegar and gur in a saucepan on another burner.
Bring the vinegar to a boil and then simmer to dissolve the gur.
When the oil is heated enough for a piece of vegetable thrown in to come up at once, keeping the heat on high, add the ginger and the garlic, and stir fry till a light brown.
Add the shalgam, gobhi and gajar and continue stirring over high heat. This has to be stirred long enough to evaporate the water in the vegetables.
You will know it is done, when the liquid in the vegetables gets back the colour of the oil.
Add the powdered spices and salt, mix well, again over high heat, and then add the vinegar solution. Let it come to a boil and shut off the heat.
name: Gobhi Shalgam ka Achaar

description: Serve this yummy and easy to make peanut sauce with chicken satay.
ingredients: 3 Tbsp roasted peanuts with skin, crushed in a mortar and pestle
method: Heat coconut milk.
Add smashed peanuts and boil.
Add palm sugar.
Add curry paste and mix.
Season with salt and taste.
Sauce will thicken as it cools.
name: Peanut Sauce

description: An easy to make yummy coriander ki chutney that goes best with kebabs and other Indian starters.
method: In a blender/ mixie add coriander leaves and blend till the leaves are crushed.
Add garlic, chopped green chillies, salt and lemon. Blend till smooth. Add a little water in case the mixture is too thick.
Put it in a bowl and mix with curd.
Serve with some onion ringlets and kebabs.
name: Dhaniye Ki Chutney

description: Thousand Island Sauce is frequently used as a dressing for salads. It is made with mayonnaise, chilli powder and tomato ketchup. Egg and celery are added in this recipe to give some flavor.
method: Place all the ingredients in the jar of a liquidizer and blend.
name: Thousand Island Sauce

description: Baba Ganoush is a Middle Eastern spread and dip similar to hummus but made with eggplant instead. Roasted eggplant, garlic and sesame seeds come together to make this delightful dip.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp garlic - finely chopped  salt to taste
1/4 cup tomato - de-seeded and chopped fine
method: Cook the eggplant over a direct flame or under a grill till dark on the outside and cooked inside.
Place in water and peel off the skin.
Chop fine or blend in a blender.
Mix in the garlic, salt, lemon juice, onion, tomato, pepper, half each of the parsley,
and oil.
Transfer to a serving dish, garnish with the rest of the parsley, til and oil.
name: Baba Ganoush

description: Easy to make sour cream recipe. Sour cream can be used as a dip or as a spread for your toasts and bagels.
method: Bring the cream to a boil.
Transfer it into the container that you want to set the sour cream in.
Let it cool to lukewarm, a drop of it on the wrist should feel neither warm nor cold.   In a small bowl, beat up the yogurt starter, till smooth.
Add 2 tbsp of the cream to the yogurt, and mix well.
Add this mixture to the rest of the cream and stir with a spoon to mix well.   Cover the container and place in a draught free place to set.
Place it in the refrigerator for a couple of hours to set further.
name: Sour Cream

description: Tomatoes cooked with vinegar, salt, brown sugar and pepper.
method: Heat the oil in a frying pan on a medium to low heat and add the tomatoes, red chili, salt, vinegar and brown sugar.
Give it a good mix and cook it for 5-10 minutes until the mixture reduces to a thick sauce.
name: Tomato Relish

description: Dip made with sour cream and onions. Served with cucumber sticks.
ingredients: 1 cucumber, peeled, de-seeded and sliced into long sticks
method: Mix all the dip ingredients together to make a sour cream dip.
Serve it with cucumber sticks.
To be eaten with:
and
name: Sour Cream Dip

description: Mint chutney with a twist of dal and coconut masala.
method: Heat oil in a pan. Add onions, garlic, and ginger. Sauté till golden brown.
Add green chillies, channa dal, urad dal, coconut. Cook till they are done. Set aside for 10 mins.
In a food processor, grind mint leaves, lemon juice, cumin powder, cooked masala, salt and little water to a smooth paste.
name: Coconut-Mint Chutney

description: Spicy curd dip with roasted peanuts.
method: Take a pan, add cumin seeds, dry red chillies broken into two, fennel seeds, peanuts and roast for a while. When done, grind this into a masala in a food processor.
Add minced garlic, coriander powder, ground peanut masala and stir. Add salt and pepper to taste.
Set to chill for some time.
Serve with blanched veggies (cucumber, beans, radish, carrot).
name: Spicy Dip

description: The tang of tomatoes beautifully spiced with mustard seeds, ginger, curry leaves and a pinch of sugar. You'll absolutely fall in love with its finger licking flavour!
method: In a wok (kadhai) add oil. Add mustard seeds, curry leaves, ginger, garlic.
Once cooked, add tomatoes. Let the tomatoes cook for 5 minutes.
Now add sugar, salt, vinegar, red chilli powder and pepper.
Cook this till the tomatoes are soft and squishy.
Serve with idli, dosa and  vada.
name: Tamatar ki Chutney

description: Dip made with jalapenos, tomatoes and spring onions. Served with tortilla chips.
ingredients: 1-2 Tbsp of coriander leaves, finely chopped
method: Grind or pound two tomatoes, the garlic and spring onions.
Pour the mixture in a serving bowl with the remaining diced tomato.
Add the salt & pepper, coriander and jalapenos.
Mix well and serve with tortilla chips.
name: Knight Rider Dip

description: Chutney made from ambiya, mint and garlic.
method: Blend all the ingredients to make a very fine paste.
Refrigerate and serve cold.
name: Mango Chutney with Mint

description: Tangy and zesty! A savory accompaniment made with tomatoes and chillies.
ingredients: 1 onion, peeled and pierced with a fork
method: In a baking dish add onions, tomatoes, green chillies, garlic cloves, olive oil, pepper and salt.
Bake for about 25-30 minutes at 180 degrees C.
Blend it together with the chipotles.
Serve with some crisp nachos.
name: Roasted Tomato Chipotle Salsa

description: A middle eastern dip made with chickpeas, tahini and seasoned mildly. Usually served with pita bread and pickled vegetables.
ingredients: Coriander leaves and olive oil, for garnish
method: Soak the chick peas overnight, boil them and drain the water.
Blend all the ingredients together into a thick paste.
If required, add some of the drained chickpea water when blending.
Pour in a serving bowl. Garnish and serve with pita bread.
name: Hummus with Coriander

description: Baked beans combined with spring onions and jalapenos. Served with tortilla chips.
method: Pour the baked beans into a serving bowl.
Add the spring onions, jalapenos and lime juice.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mix well and serve with tortilla chips.
name: Daredevil Dip

description: Tangy and tantalizing mango chutney can be remarkably versatile, use it as a spread on sandwitches or with rice/chappatis or simply dip your snacks into it!
ingredients: 1 large ripe mango, peeled and roughly chopped ½ tsp chili powder
2.5cm/1in piece root ginger, peeled and grated
method: Heat the oil in a heavy-based pan over a low heat.
Add the mango, ginger, chili powder, sugar, salt, vinegar and ginger and cook, stirring occasionally, for 15 minutes, or until the mango is soft.
Remove the pan from the heat and leave the chutney to cool completely.
Transfer the cool chutney to an airtight container and refrigerate for up to 2 weeks.
name: Mango Chutney

description: A sweet and tangy chutney with guavas, lemon, chillies and ginger.
method: Blend all the ingredients to a paste and serve.
name: Guava Chutney

description: Lemony and garlicky Tahini sauce. The perfect accompaniment.
method: In a bowl add tahini paste, garlic, salt water and blend.
Add lemon juice and blend it into a tahini sauce.
Serve with
and
name: Garlicky Tahini Sauce

description: A yummy walnut sauce with sesame and garlic. Too hard to resist!
method: To prepare walnut sauce, grind walnuts, garlic and herbs together.
Gradually pour in oils.
Sharpen with lemon juice.
Season well and serve with grilled vegetables.
name: Walnut Sauce

description: Spicy Chinese sauce that goes well with both fried rice and noodles.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp corn flour mixed in a cup of water
method: Grind together the onions, garlic and ginger.
Heat the oil in a wok add the whole red peppers and saute over high heat till they darken a bit.
Add the onions, garlic and ginger and stir-fry over high heat till glossy.
Add the corn flour mixture and bring to a boil.
Lower the heat and add the chilli powder, vinegar, soya sauce, chilli sauce and salt and mix well.
Cook till well blended (1/2 minute) and use.
name: Schezwan Sauce

description: We love to gorge on this tangy red onions in restaurants why not make them at home and stock up?
method: Peel the onions, wash and leave them in a colander to drain.
Place the vinegar in a saucepan over high heat and bring to boil.
Add the salt, sugar and the onions, and when the vinegar comes to a boil once again, shut off the heat.
Store in a sterilized, airtight jar.
name: Sirkewala Pyaaz

description: Serve it as a sandwich spread or use it as a dip, this easy carrot and cashew coleslaw recipe will please you every time.
method: Combine fruit and vegetables.
Stir in parsley.   Heat oil.
Add poppy and mustard seeds. Cool.
Add vinegar and apple juice to oil.   Mix and pour over coleslaw.
Garnish with nuts and herbs.   Serve cold.
name: Carrot and Cashew Coleslaw

description: Figs poached in delicate syrup of sugar and orange juice, and spiked with cinnamon and rum. The perfect sauce for desserts!
method: Place the sugar, water, spice, and rind into a saucepan.
Dissolve the sugar in the water and boil for 5 minutes.
Add the figs and rum to the pan.
Cover and allow the figs to simmer for 20 - 30 minutes, or until soft.
Cool.
Add the juice.
Chill well and serve scattered with nuts.
name: Fig Compote

description: Add some tang to your meals with this pickled cabbage recipe. It's perfect to add to your burgers and sandwiches.
ingredients: 100 gm spring onions - cut into 1" lengths
method: ut cabbage into 2" square pieces. Allow it to wilt for 24 hours.
Boil vinegar with sugar and salt for 3 minutes. Cool. Pour over the cabbage.
Seal in a jar and set aside for 3 days.
Heat oil, fry garlic until golden.
Add remaining ingredients and pickled cabbage.
Stir fry for 1 minute and serve.
name: Pickled Cabbage

description: A sumptuous and easy to make filling for tacos or tortillas.
method: Heat the oil and add the onions and brown lightly.
Add the beans, coriander, chilli powder, salt, cumin and oregano and stir-fry.
Add about 1 cup water and cook till beans are very tender.
Take them off the heat and mash with a fork.
name: Beans for Tortillas/Tacos

description: This beautiful looking black currant chutney with raisins is a delight to eat.
method: Blend all ingredients together with sufficient water to bring it to the correct consistency.
name: Zerish (Black Currant Chutney)

description: The sweetness of dried apricots mingles with the tang of lemon juice and chillies in this Apricot Relish Recipe.
method: Mix all the ingredients together or grind in a food processor.
Cover and chill.
name: Apricot Relish

description: An easy cheesy spread that you can use with breads, bruschetta or as a dip.
method: Put all ingredients in a blender, give it a good mix and your dip is ready.
name: Parmesan Cheese Spread

description: A nice and tangy side dish that can be relished with rice.
ingredients: 1/2 cup of mangoes (raw) cut into small pieces
4 Smoked red chillies (roasted on direct fire)
method: Grind all the ingredients except oil to a coarse paste.
While grinding mangoes should be added last.
Add coconut oil and can be used as side dish for rice.
name: Mango-coconut chutney

description: Imagine a mayonnaise without a drop of oil! Without any eggs. Totally vegan. Made with tofu.
method: Drain water from tofu and place it in the blender with cashew paste, lemon juice, mustard powder, salt and pepper.
Blend at highest speed until light and creamy.
Now add sugar and wasabi paste.
Blend again and keep aside.
You can serve it with some crackers or apply in sandwiches.
Take a pan and in a little olive oil, saute garlic, mushrooms, babycorn, bell peppers till they get translucent. Add a few sprigs of thyme.
Once done, mix the mayonnaise into this potpourri.
You can serve this with crackers or pour it into ready made tart cases.
Garnish with cherry tomatoes and basil leaves.
name: Tofu and Cashew Mayonnaise

description: A zingy coconut chutney with tamarind, ginger and chillies.
ingredients: 2 inch piece ginger skinned and washed
Tamarind  size of a small lemon
method: Grind all the ingredients except oil to a coarse paste.
Add coconut oil and can be used as side dish for rice.
name: Coconut-Ginger Chutney

description: A tangy side dish to go with Falafels. Yogurt whisked with green apples, plums, pomegranate seeds and orange juice.
method: Add the hung yogurt to a large mixing bowl.
Slice the green apples into thin slivers and dice the plums and add to the bowl.
Add the pomegranate seeds, rose water, orange juice, cardamom powder, salt and mix well.
name: Plum and Green Apple Yogurt

description: Made out of creamy yogurt, eggplant, olive oil, herbs and seasoning, burnt eggplant dip can be served with chips, lavache or breadsticks.
method: In a mixer put the sliced eggplant, yoghurt, mint, garlic, cumin, cinnamon, tahini paste, lime juice and lemon zest and olive oil give it a nice blend.
Check the consistency and you can add some more olive oil and yogurt.
Blend to a smooth paste.
Serve with chips, lavash or breadsticks.
name: Burnt Eggplant Dip

description: A fresh accompaniment without which the an Indian meal seems incomplete!
method: Take the curd and add onion, cucumber and lemon juice.
And season it with salt, red chilli powder and coriander leaves.
Mix it all.
name: Kheere ka Raita

description: The most popular dip from Middle East can now be made at home.
method: In a blender add the chickpeas, olive oil, garlic, lime juice, tahini paste and salt.
Give it a good blend till it reaches a good thick velvety consistency.
Garnish with a sprinkle of sumac powder.
name: Vicky's Hummus

description: Zesty bell pepper chutney that can be paired with a range of dishes.
method: In a big pan, add a little olive oil and fry a clove, fennel seeds, black peppercorns, cinnamon stick, cumin powder, star anise, black peppercorns and ½ a dried red chilli.
Add the chopped onions, minced ginger, bell peppers and the peach along with a big pinch of orange zest.
Add the jaggery and rice wine vinegar.
Reduce till the vinegar has reduced.
Cook for 10 minutes until the onions and peppers are soft but not mushy.
Add the juice of half an orange.
Season to taste with salt and pepper.
Add chopped mint and coriander leaves.
name: Peach and Bell Pepper Chutney

description: Classic salsa recipe with juicy tomatoes and a smoky onion flavour.
method: Char the onions on a gasflame. After the skin blisters, let it rest for 15 minutes and then peel.
Mix all the ingredients and let them sit for 10 minutes before serving.

Place the onions or garlic on a very hot griddle and turn them around till all the skin is blistered and black. Then leave them to cool (some prefer to keep them in a plastic bag) and then peel. It gives a lovely smoky flavour and a juicy texture to the onions.
name: Tomato Salsa

description: Subhalaxmi Khan, a professional dancer prepares tangy pickle made from olives, spices and honey. This one is an Assamese delicacy.  Most people think olives are from Spain but they also grow wild in the interiors of Assam and are therefore used extensively in their cuisine.
method: Heat some mustard oil into the pan.
Add gur and mix it well on medium heat
Add olive and mix.
Then add salt, paanch phoron, chilli powder, roasted jeera and cook for a few minutes
Finsh it off by adding some honey.
name: Olive Gur Chutney

description: Made with jalapenos, tabasco, capsicums and creamy yoghurt. This Mexican dip goes with a range of finger foods.
method: Mix all the ingredients to make a dip.
Use as substitute for sour cream with
and
name: Mexican Yogurt Dip

description: Radish, cabbage, pears and bell peppers tossed and coated with a freshly made tangy dressing.
ingredients: One and a half tsp vegetable oil
method: Slice the radish and shred the cabbage into fine strips, put in a bowl of water with lemon juice, to avoid discoloration.
Slice the pear and the bell peppers and put it in the same bowl.
In another bowl make a dressing with sweet chili sauce, rice wine vinegar, ginger, mint leaves, egg less mayonnaise and vegetable oil and whisk together.
Drain out the water from the vegetables and pat dry.
Add these vegetables to the dressing and mix well.
Once all the vegetables are coated in the dressing your slaw is ready.
name: Radish Slaw

description: An innovative and tangy dip made with pomegranates, tamarind and crushed rose petals.
method: Grind all the ingredients together.
Garnish with poppy seeds powder and serve.
name: Pomegranate Chutney

description: A zesty red bell pepper salsa served with pickled vegetables and a dry melba toast. Perfect start to your brunch party.
ingredients: 50 gm chopped red bell peppers, ground
Melba toast (Melba toast is a dry, crisp and thinly sliced toast)
method: Heat oil. Add bell pepper paste and chilli sauce. Simmer for 15 minutes with the lid on.
Remove lid and continue cooking the capsicum until the oil separates. Cool.
