Blend paste in a food processor. Sharpen with lemon juice and sprinkle in sugar to taste.
Serve with the accompaniments.
Cut the crusts off fresh slices of bread.
Roll them out thin and fine with a rolling pin.
Slice them down and brown in a moderate oven until crisp.
Serve with the dip and assorted pickled vegetables.
name: Red Capsicum Salsa with Melba Toast

description: An interesting zucchini chutney with neem leaves.
method: Heat oil in a pan.
Add all the ingredients and saute.
Cool and grind.
Serve.
name: Zucchini Chutney

description: Cabbage soaked in the flavors of garlic, ginger, soya sauce, vinegar and chilli flakes. Here's for you Kimchi Salad recipe, a Korean favorite.
method: Chop cabbage, place in a glass or steel bowl and sprinkle salt over it, and mix well.
Leave thus for 3-4 hours, till a little wilted.
Squeeze a few times till cabbage has softened.
Mix in the rest of the ingredients except the oil and transfer into sterilized jars.
Seal and leave for 24 hours, before using.
To serve garnish with some sesame oil.
name: Kimchi

description: Yoghurt, coriander and chillies make a delicious dip in a jiffy.
method: Mix all the ingredients together.
Using this base you can add or change the spices and seasonings according to taste.
name: Curd Dip

description: Chutney made from bhaang seeds, mint leaves and green chillies.
method: Roast the bhang seeds and then grind them in a mixie.
Add the green chillies, lemon juice, mint leaves, water and salt and grind to a paste in a mixie.
The
is ready.
name: Bhaang ki Chutney

description: This Middle Eastern staple can be an appetizer or an accompaniment to a main course of grilled chicken.
method: Soak the chick peas overnight and boil with little salt.
Drain and keep some liquid for
blending.
Add all the ingredients in a mixie except the paprika and blend to form a smooth paste, adding olive oil gradually.
Garnish with some more olive oil and paprika.
Serve with pita bread and sauteed vegetables.
name: Hummus

description: The sweet yet savoury flavour of the raita gives an unexpected twist to the main course.
ingredients: 2 tsp roasted and powdered cumin seeds
method: Beat the yogurt till smooth.
Add the salt, black pepper, 1 tsp of the cumin seed powder, 1 tbsp coriander leaves and mix well.
Squeeze out the pineapple, in case there is excess liquid and add to the yogurt mixture.
Transfer on to a serving bowl and garnish with the rest of the cumin powder, red pepper and coriander leaves, and serve chilled.
name: Pineapple Raita

description: Guaranteed to start any party instantly!
method: First, cut and de-seed the red peppers.
Bake them in the oven on a low temperature for 20-25 minutes and remove the skin.
Then grind all the ingredients together to make the dip.
Serve with carrots, cucumber and radishes or any other crudites.
name: Pepper Dip with Crudites

description: Easy to make Apple Sauce recipe. The apple sauce can be used in desserts or as an accompaniment to roast meat.
method: Put peeled and chopped apples in a heavy-bottomed saucepan, with the water.
Cover and cook over low heat till some of the juices are drawn, and the bottom becomes liquidy.
Remove lid and let any excess liquid dry up, taking care not to let the apples burn.
Mash them a bit to make them pulpy.
Apples can also be stewed in a pressure cooker.
Add the sugar and cinnamon and cook a little more.
name: Apple Sauce

description: Beaten curd bulked up with pieces of boiled potato and flavoured with cumin seeds, pepper and coriander leaves.
ingredients: 2 cups potatoes - boiled peeled and diced
2 tsp cumin seeds - roasted and powdered
method: Beat the yogurt till smooth.
Add salt, black pepper powder, cumin seed powder, coriander leaves and mix well with the potatoes.
Transfer onto a serving bowl and garnish with the rest of the cumin powder, red pepper and coriander leaves.
Serve the Aloo ka Raita chilled.
name: Aloo ka Raita

description: Green chillies with mustard oil, tamarind and spices will add a kick to the simplest Indian meal.
ingredients: 100 gm cumin seeds - roasted and ground
200 gm large mustard seeds - roasted and ground
method: Marinate the chillies in salt for at least two hours.
Soak the
in the vinegar for at least two hours and extract the pulp.
In a large vessel heat the mustard oil and add red chilli powder and turmeric powder.
Add the ginger and garlic and mix well.
Continue stirring for some time.
Mix in the cumin powder and mustard powder.
Pour the imli-vinegar pulp and mix well.
Add sugar and cook on low heat for some time.
Now add the chillies and cook for 10-15 minutes on low heat till the oil separates.    Serve.
name: Green Chilli Pickle

description: An easy to make onion relish that will liven up any meal.
method: Blend all ingredients together into a paste and serve.
name: Onion Chutney

description: Pickled chicken pieces add flavour to a simple meal of rice and dal.
ingredients: 2 kg chicken - cut into 16 pieces each
60 gm ginger - peeled and chopped, coarsely pounded
method: Heat oil in a
and add the ginger and the garlic and stir fry till they turn light brown in colour.
Add the chicken and continue stirring over high heat till chicken pieces are opaque.
Lower the heat to medium and let cook, till tender.
When the chicken is tender, increase the heat and cook over high heat till the oil separates.
Add the powdered spices and salt, mix well, again over high heat, and then add the vinegar.
Let it come to a boil and switch off the heat.
name: Murgh ka Achaar

description: Leave these lentil bites to dry after shaping them and store them for additional crunch and flavor to any vegetable dish.
method: Rub the
and wash off the skin.
Grind it to a fine paste on a grinding stone or a food processor.
Leave to rest, covered for 4-5 hours.
Soak the
in a little water to dissolve.
Beat the ground lentils till fluffy, and add the
to it.
Make the
drop equivalent to about 1 Tbsp of batter on to the cloth till all the batter is used.
These have to be left to dry out in the sun. When the top seems quite dry, try to pullout a
. If it comes clean off the cloth, turn the cloth over, so that the bottom is exposed for drying.
When dry, pull all the
off the cloth, pack them in polythene bags, seal and store.
name: Mangauri or Moong Dal Badi

description: Chili red pepper sauce, serves as the perfect accompaniment for a host of dishes.
method: Roast red bell peppers on a grill (toss the red bell peppers in olive oil and salt) grill until charred  put in a bowl and cover with cling film.
Let them wrinkle, then peel, deseed and slice.
Season with some salt and pepper.
In a blender, add all the ingredients and blend while pouring the olive oil in a steady stream to emulsify to a thick rich sauce.
name: Hot Romesco

description: Sweet and spicy relish of pineapple, vinegar and cinnamon.
ingredients: 2 tsp chopped spring onions, to garnish
method: In a pan mix together vinegar and sugar. Let it reduce.
Add lemongrass, star anise, cinnamon, kafir lime leaves, lime juice, peppercorns, garlic, ginger and mix well.
Once the mixture starts to thicken add the pineapple pieces. Cook for 1 more minute.
Finish with the chopped spring onions and chopped coriander.
Serve with
name: Pineapple Chutney

description: A Southern chutney of gongura leaves, tamarind, onion and spices.
method: Wash
leaves, fry in a pan with little oil. Close the pan with a lid, cook for a while.
Add the tamarind juice. Using a pestle, pound the cooked leaves.
Add salt, 1/4 Tbsp sugar, all powdered ingredients till every thing blends well.
Season with mustard and add onions.
Mix with 1 cup of boiled water. Serve
name: Gongura Pachadi

description: Easy to make mint sauce goes well with roast or baked meat.
method: Heat the vinegar and sugar in a saucepan over low heat, stirring all the time.
Heat till the sugar is dissolved, then bring it to a boil and add the mint leaves and immediately shut off the heat and add the salt.
Your mint sauce is ready. This sauce keeps well if you pack it in a sterilised, screw top bottle while it is still quite hot.
name: Mint Sauce

description: Spicy sauce that will add punch to snack time.
ingredients: 1 kg green chillies - washed and chopped
1 tsp sodium benzoate - dissolved in 2 Tbsp of boiled water
method: Dissolve the salt in the vinegar and marinate the green chillies in it for 1 hour at least.
Heat the mixture and bring to a boil.
Cook over high heat till it thickens a bit.
Take it off the heat and mix in the sodium benzoate mixture.
Store in an airtight clean bottle.
name: Green Chilli Sauce

description: The usage flexibility of this sauce makes it a keeper in your kitchen.
method: Cook the tomatoes and garlic together till soft.
Strain through a soup strainer, or blend in a blender and then pass through a sieve.
Put it back over high heat, add sugar, salt,
, chilli powder and vinegar and cook till thick.
The mixture begins to spurt only in the centre, when ready.
Take off the heat; add the sodium benzoate solution (a preservative) and store in airtight sterilised jars.
name: Hot and Sour Sauce

description: Mexico's all time favorite creamy avocado dip.
ingredients: A small bunch of coriander, chopped
method: Lightly mash the avocado.
Add the chopped tomatoes, onions, green chilli and chopped coriander.
Add salt and lime juice.
Mix and serve.
name: Guacamole

description: Asian black bean sauce is full of flavour and uses black beans, peanuts and rice wine.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp fermented black beans - rinsed and drained
method: Heat a wok or heavy skillet over medium-high heat.
Add the oil, the black beans and garlic. Stir-fry about 12 seconds.
Add the rest of the ingredients and stir-fry about 1 minute or until sauce thickens.
Makes about 3/4 cup sauce.
name: Asian Black Bean Sauce

description: The ideal Thai paste which can be stored up to three months.
method: Grind all the ingredients in a mortar or a food processor using a little water.
Store in an airtight container or in the refrigerator.
Alternatively, freeze for up to three months. Use as required.
name: Thai Green Curry Paste

description: Tomato based zingy goodness.
method: To prepare the sauce, combine all ingredients and serve.
Tip: It goes well with chicken in lettuce parcels.
name: Oriental Sauce

description: Tingly, zesty and fresh.
method: Combine all the ingredients together. It goes well with noodles.
name: Sweet and Sour Ginger Dip

description: The all important momo side kick.
ingredients: 25 gm dried whole red chillies - cut up and soaked in some vinegar
method: Grind all the ingredients together to a smooth paste.
name: Chilli Sauce for Momos

description: Straightforward and effortless, hot garlic sauce can be used extensively for a wide range of delicacies.
ingredients: blend the water and cornflour together
method: Grind onions, garlic & red pepper together.
Mix together, the cornflour, water, vinegar, soya sauce and sugar, and keep aside.
Heat oil in a wok and add the onion mixture, stir over high heat till fat separates.
Add the cornflour mixture and stir over low heat till cooked (becomes translucent and a little darker)
name: Hot Garlic Sauce

description: Great to pair with a variety of dishes for a subtle enhancement.
ingredients: 2 tsp corn flour dissolved in 1 tbsp water
method: Heat sesame oil. Stir-fry spring onions, garlic and chilli for 1 minute.
Add capsicum and cook for 1/2 a minute.   Stir in vinegar, sugar, sauces and stock.
Season and thicken with a little corn flour. Cook for 2 minutes.
Add pineapple to the sauce.   Serve garnished with grated cucumber.
name: Sweet and Sour Sauce

description: Peanut butter, chicken stock and coconut cream lend their distinctive flavours to this sauce.
method: Combine the ingredients in a pan. Bring to a simmer while whisking until thickened. Stir in coriander.
Season and serve.
name: Satay Sauce

description: Cucumber slices are stirred in a syrupy paste of black peppercorns, fennel seeds and chili, sprinkled with a mixture of crunchy peanut crumble.
method: In a pan add equal parts of sugar and vinegar.
Add the black peppercorns, fennel seeds and chili paste.
Add fresh lime juice and lime zest to this brine.
Heat & stir until it begins to look syrupy.
Slice the cucumber into thin slices.
Add the sliced cucumber into the pan with the brine.
Transfer into a bowl & cool.
In a blender add green chillies, coriander leaves, salt, freshly toasted peanuts and blitz until it resembles bread crumbs.
Garnish the pickled cucumber with this peanut crumble and fresh coriander.
name: Malabar Cucumber Relish with Peanuts

description: Gajar ka murabba is carrots preserved in a sugar syrup. Consumed commonly during winters.
method: Clean and de-core the carrots. Steam the carrots.   After the first steam, cook it on low flame for about 5 minutes. Remove from fire.
Spread sugar on the carrots. Cover the pan and keep aside for 1 hour. Now boil the carrots and the sugar syrup.   After the first boil, reduce flame and cook for about 10 minutes.
To preserve it for a longer period cook the syrup till it turns thick.
is ready to eat. Serve with fresh cream.
name: Gajar Ka Murraba

description: An unusual chutney made with curry leaves, onions and tamarind pulp.
method: Grind the ingredients to a fine paste and serve.
name: Curry Leaves Chutney

description: Classic pesto recipe with basil, pine nuts, garlic, cheese and olive oil. The refreshing flavour can turn around any dish.
ingredients: 1 clove garlic (or more, according to taste)
method: Wash the basil and dry it carefully with a paper towel.
Remove the stalks and start to crush in the mortar along with the garlic, pine nuts and salt.
Once you get a thick paste gradually grind in the cheese.
Finally whisk in the oil until you have reached your desired consistency
name: Pesto Sauce

description: A crisp side for your meals -  papads made with rice. Rice papads are usually prepared and served during the festival of Holi.
method: Take about a litre of water and bring it to a boil.
Now add the rice and cook for five minutes.
Drain water from rice completely. Pour this hot rice on absorbent towels.  Spread and let dry.
Heat a tablespoon of oil in a thick skillet. Add a fistful of rice at a time to this hot oil and stir continuously.
The rice will starts to puff up. When all the rice starts to puff, remove from skillet onto a tray.
Repeat. Let this rice cool and then make into a very fine powder.
Sift once or twice to see that it is very fine uniformly.
Mix the asafoetida, lime juice and salt in 1/4 cup of water.  Pass through a strainer so that only the liquid is retained.
Make a well in the center of the rice flour and pour the liquid and mix well.
Now, oil your palms and knead for about half an hour.  Use up all the oil.
Divide the dough into super sized olives and roll into thin papads.
Dry in the sun and store. Deep fry in hot oil, to serve.
name: Rice Papads

description: Here is a simple recipe of pachadi with raw mangoes and jaggery. Tempered with red chillies and mustard seeds.
ingredients: 200 gm roasted peanuts - skinned and removed
method: Peel and slice mangoes with seeds.
Split green chillies in half.
Pour over water to cover fruit and chillies.
Simmer till well cooked.
Add jaggery to pan.
Heat oil in a pan - toss in dry red chillies and mustard  seeds.
Pour over
and serve.
Grind everything together, gradually adding oil.
name: Mango Pachadi

description: Not loved by all, but this achaar of karelas loaded with spices might just do the trick.
method: Scrape off the rough surface of the bitter gourd, slit lengthwise on one side, rub all over with salt and keep aside for 3-4 hours.
Squeeze the
to get rid of the discarded juices, scoop out the seeds and wash and squeeze again.
Mix a little bit of the lemon juice into the
to dampen it, then stuff the filling firmly into the
and tie each one to secure the filling.
Place the filled
neatly into the sterilized jar and pour enough lemon juice to cover.
Sun for 3-4 days and eat after a week.
Once ready, you could cut and serve small pieces.
name: Karele ka Achaar

description: A recipe from the safe haven of homeliness, Himachal Pradesh. Chef Mansingh of Woodville Palace Hotel shows how to make a crisp Himachali style papad.
method: Add the salt and water to the refined flour and mix to a thick consistency.
Pour a large ladle of the mixture onto a steel plate and spread it out evenly. Steam the plate so that the dough can come off easily.
Remove the dough when dry and keep it on a clean cloth in the sun for 3 days.
Deep fry the shakuli in refined oil and serve with any meal.
name: Shakuli (Himachali Papad)

description: Chutney made with variety of lentils, roasted dhania, cumin seeds, chillies, onions and curry leaves. A perfect accompaniment that will give your bland meals a new twist!
method: Grind the roasted ingredients and imli together, with the help of water as required.
Mix in the salt.
Heat the oil, add the sarson, onions and kadhi patta.
Saute till onions are brown, and mix into the chutney.
: You can mix in some yogurt if you so desire.
name: Dal ki Chutney

description: Delicate and aromatic. This rose syrup recipe is perfect to add in your desserts.
ingredients: 1 cup red rose petals - tightly packed
method: In a wide and deep pan, put the rose petals and cover with water. Leave this overnight.
Add sugar to the rose petal and water mixture and stir over low heat, till sugar is dissolved.

When dissolved, increase the heat and let it come to a boil and cook till thickened--one thread consistency. That is take a drop of the mixture and press between your thumb and forefinger, a thread should form when you separate the fingers.
Strain through a muslin cloth and store in a clean, airtight bottle.
name: Rose Syrup

description: A decadent chocolate icing for your cakes.
method: Mix the icing sugar, butter and vanilla in a bowl and beat together to cream it, adding milk when required for smooth movement.
Continue to add milk till a spreading consistency is reached.
Spread over the cake.
name: Chocolate Icing

description: The basic recipe for most North Indian gravies, tamatar pyaaz ka masala.
method: Grind onions, garlic and ginger to a paste.
Heat oil and add cumin seeds and bay leaves.
When the seeds begin to splutter, add the onion paste and saute till brown and fat separates.
Add tomatoes or puree, turmeric, salt,
, red pepper and the coriander powder, and stir fry till the fat separates.
name: Tamatar Pyaaz ka Masala

description: Spicy and garlicky, this chutney is absolutely lip smacking.
ingredients: 25 gm dried whole red chillies-cut up and soaked in some vinegar
method: Grind all the ingredients together to a smooth paste, avoiding, water.
name: Garlic Chutney

description: Smother your toasted bread with some homemade mixed fruit jam.
ingredients: 1/4 cup lemon juice or to taste
method: Put the fruit in a steel or glass container, cover with water and keep overnight.
Transfer to a heavy based sauce pan, bring to a boil and cook till soft.
Strain through a soup strainer or blend and strain.
Put back onto the stove and bring to a boil again and cook, stirring to avoid scorching.
When slightly thinner than jam consistency, add the sugar and lemon juice.

Lower the heat and keep stirring till sugar is dissolved (not letting it coming to a boil before that).   When sugar is dissolved, bring to a boil and cook, stirring all the time (else it will caramelise at the bottom and change flavor).
When a drop placed over a cold surface sets, the jam is ready.
Store in sterilized airtight jars.
name: Mixed Fruit Jam

description: A nice and tangy side-dish made with mangoes, peppercorns, bay leaf, asafoetida  and cloves. Savour it with rice or spread it over sandwiches/rotis or simply use it as a dip for snacks, this will come handy in most of your dishes.
method: In a steel or a glass bowl, mix in the grated mango and sugar.
Tie with a piece of muslin and keep in the sun, stirring twice a day for about 4 days.
Mix in the salt, chilli powder, peppercorns and powdered garam masala and continue sunning till the sugar dissolves.
Transfer into a sterilized jar and store.
name: Aam ki Chutney

description: A tasty homemade strawberry jam without any preservatives. Spreads smoothly on your toast, this jam is worth trying.
method: Wash the strawberries and hull them. Leave them for water to drain out completely.
In a stainless steel sauce pan layer the strawberries in the pan and sprinkle them with the sugar as you go.
Leave thus overnight, (for sugar to draw out the juices, firm the fruit and they will stay more whole in the jam).
When you make the jam place the pan over low heat to melt the rest of the sugar, (do not let it come to a boil till sugar is dissolved) shake the pan now and then, don't stir too much.
When the sugar is dissolved add the lemon juice and turn up the heat, when the jam bubbles start timing, begin with 8 minutes and then remove from the heat.

Spoon a little jam on a plate, let cool, then push with your finger, if you get a crinkly skin it is set.   If not, boil it up again for another 3-5 minutes and do the test again, if necessary do more repeats.
When ready remove from the heat, stir in the butter to dissolve the scum and let the jam settle for 15 to 20 minutes.
Pour the jam in dry clean jars, which are heated in the oven for 5 minutes (325F) Cover with waxed discs and seal with lids or cellophane.
name: Strawberry Jam

description: Oranges and lemons, fresh on the table. A delicious citrus marmalade to perk up your breakfast.
method: Squeeze the juice of the oranges and lemons. Cook the juice along with water over a moderate flame.
Remove membrane, pips and pith from the fruit and tie securely inside a muslin bag.
Shred peel into strips and add to the juice along with the muslin bag.
Cook juice until the liquid has evaporated by 1/3.   Add sugar and dissolve. Boil rapidly until setting point is reached.
Drop in butter and skim out any impurities from the surface.
Store in a cool and dry jar.
The pips tied in the bag, help produce pectin so you do not need to add any.
name: Orange Marmalade

description: A sweet, sticky and sensual syrup bursting with the addictive aroma of cinnamon.
method: Mix sugar and water and stir over low heat, till sugar is dissolved.
When dissolved, add the cinnamon and increase the heat and let it come to a boil and cook till thickened (one thread consistency).
That is take a drop of the mixture and press between your thumb and forefinger, a thread should form when you separate the fingers.
Strain through a muslin cloth and store in a clean, airtight bottle.
name: Cinnamon Syrup

description: The classic pungent tasting mustard sauce, now made at home.
ingredients: Vinegar - to cover the above ingredients
method: Place yellow mustard, mustard, honey, cinnamon and salt in a glass or stainless steel vessel and cover with vinegar to come up about 1/2" above the mixture.
Leave it for 48 hours.   Blend to a fine paste and use.
name: Mustard Sauce

description: A tangy mixture used in the preparation of the popular South Indian Sambhar.
method: Roast all the ingredients, except the turmeric powder, till very slightly colored.
Remove from the heat and cool, and grind to a powder and mix in the turmeric powder.
Store this
in an airtight jar.
name: Sambar Masala

description: A chewy, fudgy, sticky treat made with fresh guavas. Guava cheese is a popular Goan delicacy. It has a long shelf life.
ingredients: Sugar (depends on the proportion of pulp as mentioned in the recipe)
method: Cut ends of guavas, cut into 4 and slice off the seeds.
Cut into small pieces (with skin on).
Place chopped guava in a pan and add water to cover.
Cook until soft and strain through a cloth, squeezing and keeping the pulp for the cheese.
Make jam with the pulp, using proportion of 4 cups pulp to 3 cups sugar and 2 Tbsp lemon juice.   Weigh the pulp and mix with equal weight of sugar and 2 Tbsp. lemon juice.
Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring to avoid scorching, till it leaves the sides of the pan and forms a ball.
Spread on to a greased plate to set. Cut into squares and store in an airtight jar.
Guava cheese can be eaten simply as a dessert or with sandwiches, toasts, etc.
name: Guava Cheese

description: This decadent chocolate cream smothered over a cake or tarts can change the whole flavor.
method: For chocolate cream scald milk.
Beat in yolks and sugar together for five minutes.
Stir in flour.     Pour on hot milk.
Return to pan, stirring continuously.
Stir in chocolate and allow it to melt.
Cool. Fold in whipped cream.
name: Chocolate Cream

description: Its an easy recipe to make your ordinary tasting cake extra ordinary. This butter icing slathered on your cake is a treat.
method: Mix all the ingredients together and beat with an electric beater till stiff peaks are formed.
Remember; add the milk gradually so that you don't add too much.
Spread over the cake.
name: Butter Icing

description: Who doesn't love a freshly made jam on the dining table? A fruity delight that smoothly spreads on the toasted bread. This apple jam is easy to make and preservative free.
ingredients: 1/4 cup lemon juice or to taste
method: Put the apples in a steel or glass container, cover with water and keep overnight.
Transfer to a heavy-based sauce pan, bring to a boil and cook till soft.
Strain through a soup strainer or blend and strain.
Put back onto the stove and bring to a boil again and cook, stirring to avoid scorching.
When slightly thinner than jam consistency, add the sugar, lemon juice and
Lower the heat and keep stirring till sugar is dissolved (not letting it coming to a boil before that).
When sugar is dissolved, bring to a boil and cook, stirring all the time (else it will caramelize at the bottom and change flavour).
When a drop placed over a cold surface sets, the jam is ready.
Store in sterilized, airtight jars.
name: Apple Jam

description: Its easy. Its tasty. Its going to make your desserts a little more yummy. Make this caramel sauce at home.
method: Melt sugar in a heavy pan and heat till a rich golden brown.
Gradually pour in warmed cream.
Dissolve over a gentle flame.
Add butter in small pieces.
Set aside
name: Caramel Sauce

description: Tomato ketchup made at home. The solution to a bland sandwich, a non-juicy burger or with a plate of pakoras. Pair it up and get the tang in the dish.
method: Cook the tomatoes and garlic together till soft.
Strain through a soup strainer, or blend in a blend and then pass through a sieve.
Put it back over high heat, add sugar, salt,
, chilli powder and vinegar and cook till thick.
The mixture begins to spurt only in the center, when ready.
Take off the heat, add the sodium benzoate (a preservative) solution and store in airtight sterilized jars.
name: Tomato Ketchup

description: An aromatic biryani ka masala made in the microwave.
method: Dry roast all the ingredients.
Cool and powder.
Store in an airtight jar.
name: Biryani Masala

description: Fafda is a popular Gujarati snack made with gram flour, turmeric and carom seeds. It is fried crisp and served with chutney.
ingredients: 1/2 tsp salt tsp or to taste
method: Mix the
, soda,
, 1 tbsp oil and salt together.
Add water and knead into a soft dough.
Take a portion of the dough and place it on a greased surface.
With base of your palm, drag the dough in a straight line, holding the dough at the starting point with the other hand.
This will form a strip.
Fry these strips over medium heat till crisp.

This is a difficult thing till you are practiced enough. You can also 
roll into thin rounds between two sheets of greased polythene.
name: Fafda

description:
Kachri is a wild variety of cucumber that resembles a brown yellow small melon. When mixed with garlic, salt, red chilli powder, turmeric and coriander, it makes a spicy and delicious Rajasthani chutney.
A delicious and spicy chutney from the house of Rajasthan
method: Soak the kachri for 5-6 hours and grind it to a fine paste.
Then mix well the kachri paste, garlic, salt, red chilli powder, turmeric, coriander powder.
Take oil in a pan.
Add the cumin seeds and let them crackle.
Add the asafoetida as well as the kachri mixture to it.
Add around 60 ml of lukewarm water.
Let it simmer for 4-5 minutes and remove from fire.
Instead of pre packed red chilli powder, freshly ground red chillies give a far better flavour.
name: Kachri Ki Chutney

description: Enjoy freshly made tacos at home with this easy recipe. Fill in your favorites and dig in.
method: Mix the
, baking powder, salt, shortening and warm water and knead into a soft dough.
Roll out thin
and cook over griddle (
), on both sides.
When cool, deep fry the
to a light brown and bend them gently to form a half folded round.
name: Taco Cups

description: Cooking Chinese delicacies made easier with this basic Manchurian sauce recipe.
ingredients: 3 Tbsp corn flour-blended with 1/2 cup water
2 Tbsp chopped celery or 1/4 tsp celery salt
method: Mix all the ingredients, bring to a boil and simmer for 1/2 a minute.
name: Manchurian Sauce

description: A masala that you can make today to simplify your cooking later.
method: Saute all the ingredients in the oil over low heat, till very slightly colored.
Cool and then grind to a powder.
Store in an air-tight jar.
name: Paav Bhaji Masala

description: This sensational condiment has made its way to every Indian home and is a true testament to how much Indians love their spices. A mix of fresh vegetables and fabulous mangoes, this mixed achaar will send your taste buds on a joy ride.
ingredients: 8 carrots-scraped and cut into desired sized pieces
method: Mix carrots, mangoes, cauliflower, cucumbers, peas and salt and leave for 3-4 hours.
Drain the vegetables well and discard the liquid.

Mix
 the vegetables, chilli, mustard, vinegar, fenugreek, turmeric and oil. Transfer to a jar and leave to mature, stirring once or twice a day.
The pickle will be ready to eat in 6-7 days.
You can add permissible red color if you want it to look brighter.
name: Aam ka Pachranga Achaar

description: A sweet and sour chutney that goes well with all those crisp tea-time treats.
method: Soak the tamarind in water till soft and pulpy.
Strain and add enough water to have a thin pouring consistency.
Add remaining ingredients and bring to a boil, then simmer over low flame, till it thickens a little.
Cool and serve.
name: Sonth ki Chutney

description: Serve up a luscious red chutney that's not only easy to make but goes with almost anything on the dinner table.
method: Heat some oil, add brown onions and ginger-garlic paste to it and cook till they brown.
Add tomatoes, sugar, salt, chilli powder and garam masala and cook to a thick consistency.
Add vinegar and simmer for about 5 minutes. When cool, pack in an airtight clean jar and store.
name: Tomato Chutney

description: A fine blend of coconut, curd and pineapple combined with fiery chillies and spices.
ingredients: 2 Tbsp coconut paste mixed with spices and mustard oil
method: Heat oil in a pan and splutter some mustard.

Add green chillies, red 
chillies, curry leaves and ginger.

Now add pineapple and coconut 
paste.
Cook for few minutes.
Finally add curd.

Mix well and 
serve.
name: Pachadi

description: A sweet and sour date chutney that goes brilliantly with pani puri, alo chaat and all kinds of crispy snacks.
ingredients: 250 gm dates-soaked in water that covers the dates. Leave it soaked for about 2-3 hours.
method: De-seed the dates and blend them smooth in a blender. Keep adding water to make ensure it's of pouring consistency.
Add the ginger powder, tamarind pulp, chilli powder, salt and boil. Lower the heat and simmer for about 5 minutes.
name: Sweet Date Chutney (Khajoor ki Chutney)

description: Whip up a bowlful of this comforting raita with onions, cumin, chillies and coriander to enhance the flavour.
ingredients: Garnish chilli powder roasted cumin crushed
method: Whisk the yoghurt along with the cream and salt.
Mix in the cumin powder, sliced onions, chopped green chillies and coriander leaves.
Serve garnished with cumin and chilli powder.
name: Pyaaz ka Raita

description: Here is a recipe to make the base of a pizza with flour, yeast and olive oil.
method: Sieve flour with salt.
Add yeast to tepid water and stir in sugar and leave aside for 6 to 8 minutes.
In a mixing bowl, create a well in the middle of the flour mixture and add 100ml of yeast mixture and 15ml olive oil.
Add in the rest of yeast mixture and remaining olive oil.
Flour the kneading surface so that the dough does not stick.
Mix together with your fingers till you have a dough. Knead for 10 minutes till you have an elastic, even product.
Proving the Dough:
Place the dough in a bowl and drizzle generously with extra virgin olive oil.
Cover bowl with cling film and place in a warm area to prove for 50 minutes.
After the dough is proved, bash the air out and cut into small pieces for individual pizzas.
Dust the work surface and rolling pin with some flour before rolling out the dough.
name: Dough For Pizza

description: Back to basics. Enjoy a freshly made pizza base with this recipe.
method: Dissolve sugar in 1/2 cup lukewarm water.
Sprinkle yeast over the water and leave in a draught-free place to froth.
Sieve the refined flour with salt and rub the oil into it.
Add yeast solution and knead into a smooth, but not stiff dough, using water as required.
Place in a greased bowl and cover with a thick, damp cloth or cling foil.
Place in a warm draught-free place to rise.
When the dough has doubled, punch it in the center, smoothen it and leave to rise once again.
To test, press into the dough lightly and the impression should fill up gradually when your dough is ready.
name: Pizza Dough

description: A quick and delicious recipe for making pizza sauce from tomatoes and a tangy seasoning.
method: Pour some olive oil in a pan and add in tomatoes.
Chop the bulbs of garlic and add them into the pan, drizzle a few drops of Worcestershire Sauce and add in sugar.
Season with salt and pepper.
Mash the tomatoes to achieve an even consistency and bring the mixture to a simmer.
Strain the mixture into a bowl and transfer the sauce the same pan and simmer for another 5 to 7 minutes.
name: Pizza Sauce

description: A very easy to make crisp pie crust.
method: In a plate/ deep dish sieve the flour and salt together. Make sure there are no lumps.
Add the softened butter and mix it together with hands to make a crumbly mixture.
With the help of some cold water combine the whole mixture together.
Do not knead the dough, it is supposed to be gently combined together. Store in the fridge for 10 minutes.
Once this is done, roll out the dough (1 cm thick) on a flat and clean surface. Make sure the dough is rolled in forward direction, do not roll haphazardly.
According to the size of your pie tin, cut out the dough and place it carefully in the tin.
Place a small piece of butter paper on the pie tin. Place 6-7 dry
on it (This procedure is called bake blind. It is important to bake blind so that the pie doesn't rise.)
Bake for 5 minutes at 180 degrees.
Remove the paper and
and bake it till golden and crisp. Remove from oven.
Let it cool and fill the crisp pie shells with a filling of your choice.
name: Pie Crust

description: These pickled cucumbers are an ideal blend of sweet and sour. They pair up not only with evening snacks but are also a great way to brighten up any bland meal.
method: Wash and prick the tendlis.
Scrape and slice the carrot into thin rounds.
Place both the vegetables in a glass or stainless steel jar and sprinkle the salt over it.
Cover with water and let them stand overnight.
Next morning, drain the water, add vinegar, sugar and black pepper and bring to a boil.
Simmer for 3 - 4 minutes, remove from heat and store in an airtight sterilised jar.
name: Pickled Cucumbers (Kundru ka Achaar)

description: The classic mayo dip made without eggs, with milk, oil and vinegar. Use in sandwiches or solo as a dip.
method: Make white sauce with the flour, fat and milk.
When cold, add the rest of the ingredients and mix well.
Chill it, and your mayonnaise is ready.
Keep this in an airtight bottle in the fridge for 5-6 days.
name: Eggless Mayonnaise

description: This palatable pickle of green chillies is stuffed with a spice mix and generous squeeze of lime.
ingredients: 1 kg large green peppers-washed and wiped dry

1/4 cup fenugreek 
seeds - roasted and powdered fine

1 Tbsp asafoetida - roasted and powdered 
fine
method: Slit the peppers lengthwise.

Mix together 3/4 cup salt, fennel seeds, 
mustard seeds, turmeric, onion seeds, fenugreek seeds and asafoetida.
Mix in 1/4 cup each of the lemon juice and the oil too.

Fill the peppers
 with the spice mixture and pack them into a clean jar.

Pour the rest of
 the lemon juice over the peppers and leave thus for 3-4 days.

Heat the
 rest of the oil, cool it to room temperature and pour into the jar 
after 3-4 days.
Keep it covered with oil, to prevent it from spoiling.
name: Hari Mirch Ka Achaar

description: This basic tomato and basil sauce with onions, chilli flakes , balsamic vinegar and pepper smothered over some silky pasta is delicious.
ingredients: Bunch of basil leaves, torn into small pieces
method: Heat the oil in a saucepan and gently cook the onion and garlic until softened.
Stir in the tomatoes, chili flakes, vinegar and sugar.
Bring to a simmer and cook slowly for 45 minutes to 1 hour.
Stir in the basil and season with salt and pepper.
This sauce can be left chunky or blended in a food processor for a smooth sauce. Serve spooned over cooked pasta.
name: Tomato and Basil Sauce

description: Sour limes flavored with aromatic spices. An all time favorite accompaniment across the country, this simple yet impressive lemon pickle is a hit in every Indian household.
ingredients: 1 kg sour limes-washed and wiped dry, cut into 4 pieces each
method: Mix all the ingredients together.
Transfer into the jar.
Keep it under the sun for about a month.
You can also  add some sliced ginger to it if you desire.
name: Nimbu ka Saada Achaar

description: Role the dough into desired shapes and sizes cannelloni, ravioli, thin noodles etc and enjoy a fresh and homemade pasta.
method: Add salt to the flour, rub oil in and mix in the egg.
Add water, a little at a time, to knead into a stiff dough.
Rest the dough, covered, for half an hour or so.
Roll as thin as possible, and cut into desired size and shapes -- thin noodles, tagiatelle (flat broader noodles), lasagne, cannelloni etc.
name: Pasta Dough

description: Spicy, savoury and super easy to make, this traditional ginger pickle will entice your taste buds.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp chilli powder or to taste
method: Mix all the ingredients and cook over high heat.
When it comes to a boil, lower the heat and simmer for a couple of minutes.
Store in a clean jar.
name: Adrak ka Achaar - Andhra Style

description: Niru Gupta brings you a staple accompaniment in every Indian household. A handful of ingredients, spices to flavour and a few simple steps will get you to this classic achaar.
ingredients:
(sour limes)- washed and wiped dry, and cut into 4 
pieces each

1 Tbsp. chilli powder or 
to taste
method: Mix all the ingredients together.
Rub the ingredients well into the cut limes.
Transfer into the jar and keep under the sun for about a month.
name: Nimbu Adrak ka Achaar

description: Pickled onions with distinctive flavours of garlic, mustard oil and fennel seeds (saunf).
method: Heat oil and add the methi, chilli powder, kalonji and turmeric.
Saute a little and add the onions and garlic.
Stir fry over high heat, till well mixed and onions and garlic are coated with oil.
Add the salt and vinegar, bring to a boil and shut off the heat.
When cool, store in an airtight jar.
name: Onion-Garlic Pickle

description: Jackfruit marinated in oil and loaded with red chilly gives you one of the spiciest Indian pickles.
ingredients: 1 1/4 cup salt + 1/4 cup for the water
prep_time: Marination Time (4 Days) + Rest Time( 3 Days)
method: Boil
with 1/4 cup salt in it.
Drain out the water and leave
to dry up. You might have to pat it dry.
When cool and dry, mix in salt,
Mix well.
Keep this covered and marinated  for 4 days, stir once a day.
Pack this tightly into a sterilized jar.
Heat the oil till the aroma is very strong.
Cool to room temperature and pour over the
The oil should come above the
mixture.
Let the pickle mature for another 2-3 days before you consume it.
Like all pickles, ensure that it stays covered with oil, so it stays good throughout the year.
name: Kathal Ka Achaar

description: This pickle is made with a combination of sweet and spicy flavours of green chillies, vinegar, jaggery, whole spices and sesame oil.
ingredients: 1/4 cup refined groundnut or sesame oil
method: Wash the chillies and let the water dry out, then chop them into twos and threes.
Mix the vinegar and the gur and cook together till dissolved into a syrup.
Heat the oil in a pan, and when heated, put in the chillies and saute over high heat till they look a little glossy.
Add the cumin, coriander and salt, and turn around till well mixed and the chillies are coated with the spices.
Now add the syrup and let the mixture come to a boil, then shut off the heat. When cool, store in a sterilised air tight jar.
name: Hari Mirch ka Khatta Meetha Achaar

description: A do-it-yourself taco seasoning recipe that can be stored for weeks.
method: Mix together all the spices and store in an airtight container.
To make tacos using this seasoning,
name: Taco Seasoning

description: Frost those lovely little cupcakes with a thick coffee cream cheese frosting.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp coffee granules dissolved in 2-3 tsp water
method: In a bowl add cream cheese and butter. Mix well.
Add sugar gradually and keep whipping till mixed well.
Add the coffee and vanilla essence.
Whip the frosting to combine everything.
Stuff it in a piping bag. Let it chill in the fridge for 5-10 minutes. Decorate the cupcakes.
Don't have a piping bag? You can just smother the cupcakes using a flat knife or spatula.
You can exclude the coffee in case you want a plain cream cheese frosting.
name: Coffee Cream Cheese Frosting

description: This simple and easy-to-make Gujarati chilli pickle has a peppy taste that can spice up any boring meal.
method: Heat some oil and add mustard seeds to it.
When the seeds splutter, add the rest of the ingredients and saute over high heat till they look glossy and slightly limp.
Cover and store in a cool place.
name: Leela Marcha nu Athaaanu (Green Chilli Pickle)

description: Frozen cubes of watermelon juice, basil and camphor which acts as a toner. So the next time you come from outdoors just rub a frozen cube on your face and feel the freshness.
method: Mix all ingredients together and pour it in an ice tray.
Place it in the refrigerator to freeze. Use a cube as and when required.
name: Natural Watermelon Toner

description: Peanut butter made at home in just two minutes.
ingredients: 3 Tbsp vegetable oil (you can add more in case the butter mixture is too thick)
method: Combine all the ingredients together and blend it in a mixer.
Spread on a toast and eat.
name: Two Minute Peanut Butter

description: Crunchy bread sticks made freshly at home. Serve with some butter and a hot bowl of soup.
ingredients: Lukewarm water to knead dough (too hot will kill yeast)
1 tsp dry yeast or 10 gm compressed (Frozen) yeast
1 egg, slightly beaten with 1 Tbsp milk and 1/4 tsp salt
In case you do not want to use egg, use 1/4 cup milk and salt mixture.
method: Follow the method for
till ready to shape.
After the second rising break dough into 6-7 lumps.
Roll one long and thin like a rope.
Cut into desired sized lengths. Repeat with the rest of the dough.
Place these on a greased baking tray about ½" apart. brush with egg mixture (or milk mixture) and leave them to double in size (10-15 minutes).
Bake in the pre-heated oven for 15-20 minutes or till brown.
Note: if you want to make the dough richer, knead in milk, instead of water, or add and egg if you like.
name: Bread Sticks

description: A peppy pickle with asafoetida (heeng) as a game-changing ingredient.
ingredients: 1/3 cup chilli powder or to taste
2 tsp heeng powder (adjust according to strength)
method: Mix all together and place into a jar and sun for a few days, or let it mature for a few days.
name: Aam ka Achaar Heeng-Lal Mirch Wala

description: Despite what the name suggests, Bombay Duck is actually a kind of fish native to the waters between Mumbai and Kutch. And yes, you can pickle that too.
ingredients: 1 bunch curry leaves- clean and remove stems
1 ginger, chopped in pieces of 1 inch each
3-4 sprigs curry leaves, clean and remove stems
method: Wash the Bombay Ducks in vinegar and drain well.
Grind the chillis, garlic, ginger, salt and turmeric to a paste.
Heat the oil and fry the fish over high heat till brown.
Drain it off the oil and keep it aside.
Fry the curry leaves in the same oil, until they turn dark brown.
Take them out of the oil and keep aside.
In the remaining oil, add the ground paste and stir fry till the fat separates.
Add the fried Bombay Ducks and cook them for 15 minutes over slow fire.
Finally add the fried curry leaves mix well and shut off the heat. Store in an airtight jar.
name: Bombay Duck Pickle

description: One of the most desirable ice cream toppings made at home in a matter of minutes. Finger licking delicious, this salted caramel sauce recipe cannot go wrong!
ingredients: A pinch of salt (fleur de sel)
method: In a heavy bottomed pan add 1 cup sugar. Start stirring with a whisk, keeping the flame on medium.
Keep stirring for about 7-10 minutes or till the sugar has completely changed from solid granules to a thick syrup. Let it change color from light golden to dark honey-amber color.
Now turn off the heat and add butter, stir continuously till the butter melts completely.
Add the cream, stir continuously till it has blended nicely and thickens.
Add a pinch of fleur de se or in case you are using normal table salt, add atleast 2 pinches
Mix well. Let it cool for 2-3 minutes.
Pour in a container and store.
Pour over ice creams, custards and cakes as a topping.
name: Salted Caramel Sauce

description: Give your bland meals a tangy twist with homemade tomato puree. This will come handy in all your dishes!
ingredients: Hot water enough to submerge the tomatoes
method: Make a cross sign with a light cut, on the base of the tomatoes(not on the stalk side).
Place the tomatoes in a bowl, boil some water and pour over the tomatoes to cover.
When cool enough to handle, peel the tomatoes (the cross sign will make this easier). Chop the tomatoes roughly and blend in a blender and strain.
Cook over high heat first, add salt and sugar and cook till it is as thick as you would like-cook till it spurts in the center.
You can now freeze it as it is in convenient sized packs.
Alternatively, add 1 tsp sodium benzoate in 2 Tbsp boiled water and add to the puree. Pack it in sterilized air tight packs.
Now in cold weather it can be stored at room temperature, and in the refrigerator in summer.
name: Tomato Puree

description: A sweet and spicy treat, candied ginger is used in a variety of desserts and can be made easily at home.
ingredients: 2 cups ginger-scraped and sliced into broad slices
method: Place ginger and sugar in a pan over low heat, stirring continuously so it does not get brown.
When the liquid dries out, and the ginger gets a transparent look, shut off the heat.
Spread to dry before storing.
name: Candied Ginger

description: The classic mayo dip is enhanced with tangy tomato puree, garlic and fresh herbs. Use it as a sandwich spread or for a dip with salads.
ingredients: 1 Tbsp chopped garden herbs (basil, thyme and parlsey)
method: In a bowl take some mayonnaise.
Then add a Tbsp of cream and tomato puree.
Add garlic paste and freshly chopped herbs.
Combine all the ingredients and mix it well.
Use it as a dip, sandwich spread or serve with appetizers.
name: Tomato Mayonnaise

description: Wondering what to do with the surplus seasonal fruits? Here's a trick, try this simple recipe, wrapped in mouth-watering flavors. A tangy dessert made of mango pulp - easy and healthy!
method: Take the pulp out of the mangoes and blend in a blender with sugar to taste and a little bit of salt.
Now take a plastic sheet and spread the pulp on to it.
Keep this on a chatai (mat) and dry it out in the sun.
When the top is dried, turn and dry some more till no moisture is left.
Your aam papad is ready.
You can do the same if you want a spicy one, by adding kala namak (rock salt) and spices to your liking.
name: Aam Papad

description: Here is an authentic Bengali condiment made of five different spices. Add this aromatic concoction to brighten up the flavour of your preparations.
method: Mix the ingredients together and store in an airtight container.
name: Panch Phoron

description: This aromatic soup is the perfect dish to help you fight off mid-week blues. The smoked flavour gives the classic pumpkin soup a whole new twist.
method: Peel and slice the pumpkin after washing it. Remove the seeds, and cut into cubes of even sizes.
Mix oil and garlic, and toss the pumpkin pieces in it to coat them well.
In an oven tray, arrange the pumpkin pieces. Sprinkle the sugar and a little salt on top.
Preheat the oven and bake the pumpkin at 160 degree Celsius till they are tender (depends on the size of the pumpkin, normally takes 10-15 minutes).
Remove the tray from the oven and cool the pumpkin.
For smoking the pumpkin ,arrange it in an inclosable chamber (may be a vessel  with loose fitting lid so that air can pass slightly).
In a small metal bowl or dish, fire up some smoke chips. Put it in the above vessel and cover it with the lid. Leave it for 10 minutes so that the pumpkin can absorb the aroma.
Remove the pumpkin pieces and puree them in a blender (add a bit of water if needed).
Pour the pureed pumpkin in a pan and heat it on medium flame. Add butter and pepper powder. Adjust seasoning if required.
Serve hot in individual soup bowl garnished with cress and pumpkin seeds.
name: Smoked Pumpkin Soup

description: These banana chips fried in coconut oil are perfect to snack on while watching the rains. They are best stored in an air tight container and can last for days.
ingredients: 4 green (unripe) plantains, peeled, sliced into thin rounds and washed
method: Put the slices of banana into a solution of water, salt and turmeric and let sit for 5 minutes.
Give it a good mix and transfer to a colander to drain completely.
In a medium sized
on high heat, heat the oil.
When it starts smoking, add the slices in small batches.
Fry until golden and transfer onto a paper napkin.
Repeat with the rest of the slices.
Sprinkle with salt and chilli powder and let it cool.
Store in an air-tight container for up to a week.
name: Banana Chips

description: This is an Italian meat sauce known as ragù alla bolognese in Italy.  It's origin dates back to the 18th century in Bologna, Italy.
ingredients: 1 tsp chilli powder or to taste
method: Heat olive oil and saute garlic, onion and keema till cooked through.
Add the tomato puree, salt, sugar, chilli powder, oregano, basil and simmer for a couple of minutes.
name: Bolognese Sauce

description: Devilled eggs, also known as picnic eggs, egg mimosa and Russian eggs, are stuffed with a creamy filling that can be spruced up in numerous ways using spices, herbs and sauces. It's ridiculously easy and hard to resist!
method: Neatly slice the eggs in halves, and then scoop out the yolks.
In a mixing bowl, add the yolks, mayonnaise and mustard sauce and mix well. Add salt and pepper accordingly to your taste.
Take a piping bag fit with a nozzle, and fill in up with the egg mixture.
Carefully fill up the egg whites with the egg mixture, making neat swirls. Serve immediately.
Additions: You can top the eggs with chopped herbs such as parsley or coriander, or even oregano and chilli flakes.
name: Devilled Eggs

description: The all-time favourite Caesar Salad gets more wholesome with penne pasta being tossed it. It makes for a quick and easy lunch meal. Top it with Parmesan and enjoy.
ingredients: 3 bread slices or ½ cup croutons
method: Clean the lettuce leaves and roughly tear them into small pieces. Keep aside.
Rub the chicken breasts with olive oil, garlic and seasonings. Pan-fry for 10 minutes, making sure that you turn sides. Remove from flame, let it cool for 10 minutes and then chop into cubes.
Pre-heat the oven to 150 degree C. Tear the bread slices into small croutons, and spread them out in a baking tray. Toss them with olive oil and season. Bake in the oven for 15 minutes until golden.
For the dressing, in a mixing bowl, whisk mayonnaise, garlic, vinegar, and salt.
In a large salad bowl, toss the pasta, chicken slices, lettuce, and cherry tomatoes. Add the dressing and toss well. Check seasoning.
Tip in the roasted bread croutons and finish with Parmesan shavings on top.
name: Chicken Caesar Pasta Salad

description: A simple yet satisfying recipe with the goodness of black olives and cherry tomatoes, tossed up with fusilli and feta, and dressed in balsamic vinaigrette.
method: For the dressing, in a mixing bowl, whisk olive oil and vinegar until they emulsify. Add the seasonings and whisk again.
In a large salad bowl, toss together pasta, olives, cherry tomatoes, spring onions and feta. Add the dressing. Check seasoning and serve.
name: Fusilli, Black Olive and Feta Pasta Salad

description: Here's how to extract fresh coconut milk at home.
method: Break a coconut and scrape out the white portion with a scraper.
Cut the coconut into small pieces.
Place the coconut in a blender and cover with water.
Blend and then strain.
This is the thicker extract, also called the first extract.
Put the leftover coconut back into the blender, add water, just enough to cover it and repeat the process for the second time.
This is the thinner extract.
name: Coconut Milk

description: Home-made vegetable stock to add freshness to your recipes.
method: Cook all the ingredients together in a pressure cooker for about 5 minutes.
If not using a pressure cooker, bring to a boil and then simmer in a covered pan for 15-20 minutes.
Strain the soup and season according to taste.
name: Vegetarian Stock

description: The popular Italian condiment gets an Indian makeover with curry leaves and cashews blending together to create a relishing treat. Toss your pastas with it for a desi twist.
method: Start by pounding the garlic and salt in the mortar with a wooden pestle, until you get a smooth paste.

Add the curry leaves, a handful at a time, and keep grinding using a circular motion until each batch of the leaves is incorporated. Make sure you are not too rough with the curry leaves; it's important to preserve the essential oils.
Add the cashew nut and grind some more.
Add the cheeses and mix well.
Add the oil, little by little, until the pesto has the right consistency. Try this with spaghetti, linguine or fusilli.
name: Cashew Pesto

description: Hung curd is nothing but yogurt drained of all its water. Here's how to make it at home.
method: Place a colander/sieve over a container; line it with a thin muslin (if it is nylon sieve which has a very fine mesh, you need not line it).
Now place the curd in it and let it drain till all the extra liquid had drained out and just a thick mass of curd remains.
name: Hung Curd

description: Get back to the basics to arrive at the newest and the sweetest way to make your cake more delicious!
method: Mix all the ingredients together to form a smooth paste.
Spread over the cake.
name: Peppermint Icing

description: Kick-start your day with a nutritious punch! Milk delicately flavored with the goodness of almonds and cardamom.
method:
Place the almonds in a bowl and pour boiling water over. Leave for half 
an hour.

Chop half the almonds fine and place the other half in a 
blender.
Place the milk, condensed milk,
powder and ice in the blender too.
Blend till well mixed and serve garnished with the chopped almonds.
name: Badaam Milk

description: Cashew is an integral part of Sri Lankan cuisine. This delectable curry is made with sweet green peas, mild spices and creamy cashew paste.
ingredients: A few sprigs pandanus leaves, optional
method: Soak the cashews for an hour. You can boil them for a few minutes in case you forget to soak them.
Fry the onions and add the curry leaves and the spices. Once the onions start to brown, add the cashew and 2 cups of water; cook for about 10 minutes.
Add green peas and the coconut milk; keep stirring on a medium to high flame until the sauce has thickened.
Try this with steamed rice or string hoppers (idiyappam).
name: Sri Lankan Cashew and Green Peas Curry (Kaju Maluwa)

description: An easy to make condiment that will add a distinct flavor to your everyday cooking. This one is a must have for your kitchen.
method: Grind together all the ingredients and refrigerate it.
Use it to marinate boiled potatoes or
, after which they can be either grilled or fried.
You can also cook the
over low flame, with a little water and grated coconut added to it.
name: Green Masala

description: Avakkai is a type of Andhra pickle. Along with a mix of spices, this recipe also used black channas.
method: Choose solid,firm and good variety mangoes.Wash,pat dry and cut in to cubes as shown.
Take mustard in a blender and powder nicely.
Place cut mangoes in a clean vessel.Add red chilli powder,turmeric powder, fenugreek powder, asafoetida, mustard powder and salt.
Add sesame oil and black channa.
Mix well. Keep it covered in a clean jar and use after a week.
The peculiarity of this pickle is addition of black channa and it gives a good aroma to the pickle, so don't avoid it.
Adding red chilli powder is up to you, you may reduce it if you want.
Do mix the jar daily once and keep it in sun light with a cloth tied to the jar. This increases the shelf live of the pickle.
name: Avakkai

description: A hearty broth made using chicken and an assortment of mushrooms - button, shiitake, shimeji, enoki, chanterelle, and simmered for over 6 hours. Patience is the key here!
ingredients: 300gm fresh mushrooms, assorted (button, shiitake, shimeji, enoki, chanterelle)
method: Heat a large heavy pan, add a few drops of oil and add the chopped bones.
Stir gently to get rid of the moisture and gradually brown the bones to a soft amber colour.
Diced carrots, onion and celery may also be added to the pan for other broths - but for this particular soup it is not suggested.
Add water to cover the bones and gradually bring the pan to a very slow simmer.
Impurities from the bones - blood, tissues etc. will coagulate and begin to rise to the surface as scum. It is very important to skim this as it collects on the surface.
Allow the broth or stock to simmer, un-covered, for 5 to 6 hours. Replenish water to keep the bones submerged.
Slice the hardier mushrooms - the button and shiitake, clean the delicate ones but leave them whole.

Once the chicken broth is ready, skim the surface for any scum one final time and then pour the clear broth into a pan through several layers of well washed muslin or cheese cloth. Reserve warm. The stock could be chilled and refrigerated, even frozen and used over weeks.

Heat another heavy pan, add a few drops of oil, sliced garlic and the julienne of ginger, and sauté for a few seconds. Add the sliced mushroom and immediately increase the heat. Stir rapidly over high heat to sear the mushrooms to a nutty golden brown.
Add a dash of the dark rice wine and then a few drops of the vinegar.
Pour the chicken stock into the pan with mushrooms and bring it to a simmer.
Season with palm sugar, salt and pepper.
Add the shimeji and simmer for a few minutes.
Serve in heated soup bowls, distribute mushrooms evenly and sprinkle the enoki and a few drops of sesame oil over each bowl.
name: Seared Mushrooms and Chicken Broth

description: A tangy pickle that tastes great with curd rice. The use of roasted and ground mustard seeds in this recipe adds an additional burst of flavours.
method: Wash and pat dry the lemons and cut into small pieces as shown. Place them in a clean bowl or vessel.Add the juices too. Add salt.
In a pan dry roast fenugreek and red chillies one by one. Place in a blender and powder finely.

Add this powder along with turmeric powder to the salt lemon mixture.In a small pan add sesame oil and add mustard seeds. Add in asafoetida. When the mustard seeds crackle switch off the flame. Cool the oil completely.
Add the oil in lemon mixture and and mix well.
Store in a clean dry container, bottle or ceramic pot for at least two days before you use.
Be sure to use a clean and dry spoon while taking the pickle out.
Use fresh firm lemon for pickles.
Also use the juice of lemon,since that enhances the flavour of the pickle.
name: Lemon Pickle

description: Nutrition-packed pumpkin hummus dip to go with your favourite tortilla chips.
method: Peel and roughly cut the pumpkin, mix garlic cloves, olive oil and roast in a pre-heated oven till golden & cooked.
name: Roasted Pumpkin Hummus

description: This easy spinach dips is warm and gooey, unlike your regular accompaniments. Serve with freshly baked tortilla chips.
method: Take 200 grams of fresh spinach and blanch in hot water, soak spinach in chilled water for 5-7 minutes.
Squeeze and drain all the water from the spinach.
Take one medium sized onion and chop finely.
Add 25 grams of chopped garlic and toss in olive oil on high flame.
Add bechamel sauce & fresh cream to the pan.
Add nutmeg and salt to taste. Let the mixture cool down and put in blender and grind for desired consistency.
Return the mix to the pan and add lime-juice and cubed artichoke hearts. Add burnt garlic for garnish. Serve warm.
Take 25 grams of polenta, 20 grams of refined flour and a pinch of salt and half a cup of water and knead until mixed well.
Roll with a rolling pin until thin. Cut the tortilla sheet into triangular shapes.
3.  Fry and serve with dip.
For the Bechamel Sauce
Melt butter in a saucepan over medium heat.
Add flour, cook, stirring, with a wooden spoon, for 1 to 2 minutes or until mixture bubbles.
Gradually stir in milk and bring it to boil.
Reduce heat to medium. Cook, stirring, for 4 to 5 minutes or until mixture thickens.
name: Spanish Artichoke And Spinach Dip

description: This super easy recipe is always a hit with kids - tender chicken smeared with a bunch of spices and fried crisp.
method: Place the chicken breast on a flat surface lined with cling wrap and hammer it with a meat mallet until you get equal thickness.
Cut the chicken breast into 2 inch thick strips (horizontally).
Place chicken strips in a mixing bowl.
Add salt, ginger, garlic and green chilli paste and mix well, ensuring the marinade gets rubbed into the chicken pieces. Keep aside to marinate for 15-20 minutes.

To make the oat crumb, place oats in a food processor, and process for 20 seconds or until coarsely ground. Add flour, salt, pepper, garlic powder and herbs. Pulse to make a coarse powder and spread out in an even layer in a plate.
To cook chicken tenders, heat a pan and brush with oil. Take each chicken strip, dredge in oat mixture and place on the hot pan, ensuring it is completely flat.
Cook until golden brown (3-5 minutes). When cooked on one side, flip over and cook on the other.
Serve hot and crispy.
name: Oat Crusted Chicken Tenders
